loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish and vegetables. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es:
Sandra, ve que su negocio es cada día más rentable y sus clientes mantienen su fidelidad, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar un horno para hacer pan así mismo invertirá en materiales para elaborar accesorios de bisutería, su ojetivo es ofrecer nuevos productos en su negocio para atraer nuevos clientes y generar nuevos ingresos.
El préstamo anterior ha sido de mucha utilidad para mantener el negocio surtido y fortalecer la venta de ropa, su familia se mantiene y su estilo de vida es más confortable.
texts.en:
Sandra sees that her business is becoming more and more profitable, and her customers remain loyal. She requests a new loan so she can buy an oven for baking bread, and to invest in materials to make costume jewelry accessories. Her objective is for her business to offer new products so as to attract new customers and generate more income.

Her previous loan was of much help to keep her business well-stocked and to strengthen her clothing sales. Her family remains afloat and their lifestyle is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy an oven for baking bread, and to invest in materials to make costume jewelry accessories.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 60 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of household goods to sell, like soap, chips, milk, and coffee.

Rosie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell, like soap, chips, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Zeena

texts.en:
Zeena is a 34-year-old woman who has seven children, five of whom are in school.

Zeena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zeena has been in this business for one year now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zeena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married mother of 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old, and some of her children are in school.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sanders, electric planers, hammers, and other tools necessary to stock her inventory

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 51 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy materials needed for her recycled materials business.

Carolina has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting another in order to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Carolina's business profile and photo in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her recycled materials business.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Gemalyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gemalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Elfha

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elfha works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Elfha is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like plastic rope, plastic bottles, etc. for her seaweed culture business.

Elfha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials in her business like plastic rope, plastic bottles, etc.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 35 years old, and she is married with one child who is in school. 

Liezl works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Liezl has been in this business for 11 years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another to further build her business.

In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to resell from her fish vending business.

Angelita has successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now requesting another to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Angelita's business profile and photo in support of Angelita's efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old, and she is married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. 

Rebecca works very hard to provide for her family. She runs her general store business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc

loans.name: Yeah's Group

texts.fr: Yeah qui se trouve sur la photo assise le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Diran Tabacoro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Yeah, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 4 à 30 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer,  ont incité Yeah à exercer cette activité depuis son enfance. Yeah cultive l'arachide et pratique le maraîchage sur parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Yeah entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la confiance créée par les agents myAgro et l'accès facilité au marché agricole. Cette année Yeah effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant plus de 20 ans que Yeah cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Yeah aimerait devenir une "grande productrice" en augmentant ses rendements mais aussi pouvoir faire construire une maison.
texts.en: Yeah, who is sitting in the photo with the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 4 farmers signed up with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Diran Tabacoro in the south of Bamako in Mali. Yeah, 47, is a mother of 8 children, ages 4 – 30, two of whom attend school. The roots of her family tradition in farming, a principal source of income and the family’s self-sufficiency in food, incited Yeah to work in this business since her childhood. Yeah grows peanuts and does truck farming on her land but must also face the challenges of farmers, such as lack of rain and farming materials. Yeah is kicking off her first year with myAgro, and signed up in order to increase her yield with myAgro’s proposed services. This year, Yeah is making payments to buy a myAgro packet of OPV seed and fertilizer to farm peanuts in order to augment her yield on her .0625 hectare of land. Yeah has been cultivating peanuts for 20 years for its food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and is used as a base sauce in food. Yeah would like to become a big producer by augmenting her yield and also to have a house built.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal, support beams and lumber to construct a roof over the corridor in her home.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира, 29 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Мунира, ее супруг и дети живут с родителями супруга. У нее средне-специальное образование. В 2006 она начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Муниры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 10 овец. На 3,22 Га земли она выращивает картофель и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунира обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 7 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в постройку сараев, дальнейшую покупку скота и приобретение собственного дома в будущем.
texts.en:
Munira is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. Munira, her husband, and their children live with her husband's parents. She has a university degree. In 2006 she began practicing field and animal husbandry. Thanks to Munira's extremely hard work, her farm now has 3 cows and 10 sheep. On 3.22 hectares of land, she raises potatoes and clover. 

In order to further expand her farm, Munira has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy 7 sheep to fatten and resell. She plans to use the proceeds from the loan to build shelters for her animals, purchase further livestock, and in the future, to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy 7 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr: Charline, 40 ans, est mariée et mère d’un enfant qui est régulièrement scolarisé. Depuis plus de 3 ans, elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires sous une tente à l’entrée de sa maison. Une boutique très fréquentée dans la zone. Courageuse et très dévouée, elle capte facilement ses clients. Son activité lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Elle veut augmenter son revenu et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Charline, 40, is a married mother of one child, who regularly attends school. For more than 3 years, she has been running a shop of food products in a tent in front of her house. The shop is frequented in the area. Courageous and very devoted, she get customers easily. Her business allows her to meet the needs of her family. She wants to increase her income and give herself the best living conditions. She is seeking a microcredit loan to augment her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cases of spaghetti

loans.name: Marie Florence

texts.fr: Florence, 39 ans, est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Pour contribuer à couvrir les dépenses de la famille, elle a entrepris de vendre des chaussures et des produits de beauté. Depuis l’ouverture de cette activité, elle n’a pas baissé les bras pour assurer la progression de son commerce. Elle a recours aux crédits pour augmenter ses stocks afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en: Florence, 39, is a married mother of five. To help cover her family’s expenses, she began selling shoes and beauty products. Since opening this business, she has never given up to ensure the growing of her business. She is seeking loans to augment her stock in order to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a bunch of women's sandals

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: Maerina est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Ufalme», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 37 ans, mère 9 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et 4 sont petits. Elle commença son business avec de fonds  reçu après la récolte dans son champ. Elle est vendeuse des  poissons salés  sur la rue du centre commercial de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 60 poissons. Elle souhaite construire une maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Maerina is a shopkeeper and member of the banque villageoise “Ufalme,” a client of IMF Hekima. She is divorced, 37, and a mother of nine, five of whom attend school and four of whom are little. She started her business with funds received after harvesting her field. She has been selling salted fish on the street of the city’s mall for 14 years. She is going to stock up on 60 fish. She wishes to build a house, send her children to school and to feed her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on 60 fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia con su madre en una comunidad tranquila donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será para invertir en la compra de animales menores y alimento balanceado para los mismos, con esto el espera mejorar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 30 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her mother in a quiet community where people earn a living in commerce, animal husbandry and agriculture. It is located in the district of Zaña in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She makes a living raising and selling small animals such as hens, ducks and guinea pigs, among others. She has been doing this work for more than three years and relies on her experience in this business and good personal and professional references in her district. The loan will be invested in the purchase of small animals and well-balanced feed for them. With this, she hopes to improve her business and make better profits, which will allow her to improve her quality of life, as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals and well-balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bakery. Evelyn is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.
Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.
Rosalie has been raising pigs for eight years now, and she has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Rosalie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jowelyn

texts.en:
Jowelyn is 48 years old, married, and has six children.

Jowelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jowelyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jowelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 47-year-old married mother of seven children, one of whom is in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. 

Carmelita has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eleonor Paula

texts.en:
Eleonor Paula, a 34-year-old married mother of two, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a dried fish making business in the Philippines for 14 years.

Eleonor Paula has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to dry and sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married. For the past five years she has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She also earns additional income by growing and fattening pigs.

Virginia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward developing and expanding her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her sugarcane field

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en:
Elgen, forty, is married and has six children, three of whom are in school. with six children. For the past three years she has bought, then sold dried fish in the Philippines.

Elgen has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. She is working hard so she can save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las fresitas”, coordinado por Julia, de 55 años, casada y optando por cuarta vez para acceder a un crédito con ADIM, solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en su taller de tapicería, quien orgullosamente lo maneja desde 30 años junto a su esposo. Con el crédito comprara materiales de principal consumo de su clientela, como esponja, tela, pega, grapas y clavos. Su meta es engrandecer su negocio y seguir prosperando. 
Sus otras integrantes, Lilliam, 48 años, se dedican a la comercialización de zapatos. Heydi  de 29 años, a la venta de ropa nueva. Con el financiamiento recibido pondrán su mayor esfuerzo para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
The group "Las Fresitas" is coordinated by Julia, who is 55, married and choosing to obtain a loan from ADIM for the fourth time. She is requesting a loan to invest in her upholstery shop, which she has been running proudly for 30 years, together with her husband. She will use the loan to buy the materials that her customers consume most, such as sponges, fabric, glue, staples and nails. Her goal is to grow her business and continue to prosper. 

Its other members are Lilliam, who is 48 and makes a living selling shoes, and Heydi, who is 29 and makes a living selling new clothes. With the financing received, they will do their best to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy the materials that her customers consume most, such as sponges, fabric, glue, staples and nails.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 49 years old, married and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

For the past four years Lani has operated a sari-sari, or general store, where she sells a variety of items such as candies, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries. She has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She is working to save enough money to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to restock her store

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es:
Juan, sigue ofreciendo el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y de carga, necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar filtros de aire, soportes, pastillas para frenos y hacer cambio de aceite en su vehículo, de esta forma seguir dando un excelente servicio con seguridad.
Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por confiar en él y darle la oportunidad de trabajar con el crédito anterior, pudo darle mantenimiento al equipo de trabajo y compro algunas herramientas para su negocio, la familia se mantiene y se encuentran en perfectas condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Juan continues to offer transportation services for passengers and cargo.  He needs a new loan to buy air filters, engine mounts, and brake pads, and to change the oil in his vehicle.  In this way he can keep providing excellent and safe service.

He is grateful to this institution and to Kiva for placing their confidence in him and giving him the chance to work.  With his previous loan, he managed to perform maintenance on his working equipment.  He bought some tools for his business.  

His family is keeping up, and they are in perfect health right now.

loans.use: to buy air filters, engine mounts, and brake pads, and to give his vehicle an oil change in order to keep offering excellent, safe transportation services.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 34, is married and has three children who are in school. For the past year she has made and sold food from her stand in the Philippines.

Elsa has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. She is working hard so she can save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes and sells

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. 

Evelyn, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 15000 to help pay for some additional computers and maintenance for her internet cafe. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of build and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for some additional computers and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, bricks, sand, pipes and metal sheets to install a sewage system and improve the kitchen.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Geraldine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing operation in the Philippines and earns additional income by selling fish.

Geraldine has been maintaining her business through her past six loans from NWTF, Kiva's field partner. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy nets and other fishing supplies. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer muy esforzada que tiene cuarenta y nueve años de edad, nunca ha dejado de trabajar para traer el sustento a su hogar, ella laboro por muchos años en un matadero de cerdos, pero luego vio la oportunidad de poner un negocio que le permitiera hacer lo que le gusta, que es cocinar, fue así como ella emprendió su comideria, actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas que luego de su trabajo le ayudan en lo que sea. 
Aunque el negocio de Aida ha logrado conseguir una buena clientela, no goza de buena infraestructura, es por eso que ella ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita remodelar su establecimiento, proporcionándole mayor calidad e higiene a la comida que ella ofrece en su negocio. Una de sus metas es poder dar a conocer su producto al norte de su pueblo, dado que es una zona turística en desarrollo y existen muchos proyectos, en los cuales los trabajadores demandan alimento. Su sueño más grande es convertir su comideria en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Aida is a very hardworking woman.  She is 49 years old.  She has never stopped working to support her household.  She worked for many years in a pig butchery, but then she saw a chance to start a business doing what she loved—cooking.  That was how she started her eatery.  She currently has the help of her daughters, who after their work help her however they can.

Although Aida’s business has managed to build a good customer base, she doesn’t have a great building.  This is why she has turned to Kiva, together with MiCrédito, so that they can award her a loan that will allow her to remodel her establishment.  In this way she can provide better quality and hygiene with the meals that she offers in her business.  One of her goals is to be able to let her products be known in the northern part of the city.  That part is a developing tourist area and there are many projects there where the workers need food.  Her biggest dream is to convert her eatery into a full restaurant.

loans.use: to remodel her establishment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past three years Gina has run a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines, where she sells canned goods, personal care products, etc. She has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.in her store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old, married, with three children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio, gracias al crédito anterior comparte un estilo de vida mucho más confortable con su familia, ha podido fabricar ventanas, puertas, portones y otras estructuras metálicas que habían encardo sus clientes, sus ingresos son mejores y con ellos cancelo las cuotas de su deuda.
Solicita un nuevo crédito que en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comprar martillos, palas, cucharas, etc., tendrá herramientas nuevas para su otra actividad de realizar construcciones por encargos, su visión es mantener su negocio con vida y atender a sus clientes como se merecen.
texts.en:

Julio's earnings have increased and he has been able to make all of his debt repayments. Julio is now seeing a new loan to buy hammers, trowels, shovels etc., in order to have new tools for his other work making constructions to order. His vision is to maintain his business in a healthy state and attend to his customers in an excellent manner.

loans.use: to buy hammers, trowels, shovels, etc., in order to have new tools for his other work making constructions to order.

Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Маржан на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 21 овца, лошадь. Маржан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Маржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.

Marzhan is 58 and married with three sons. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 1983 as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work she currently has four cows, 21 sheep and a horse on her farm.

Marzhan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 1 año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cuyes, pavos, gallinas, entre otros animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

She works raising and selling small animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, and others. She has been doing this for one year, and her business is located at home. She is requesting a loan in order to buy larger quantities of Guinea pigs, turkeys, hens, and other animals. Her goal is to increase business and meet her customers' needs. This will generate more income for her, which will improve her and her family's quality of life.

Ofelia con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella realiza esta labor desde hace nuevos. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica.
Ofelia gracias a la  amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, mucha gente lo busca, es por eso que ella ahora se ve a la necesidad de surtir mejor su tienda, pero una de las dificultades que Ofelia tiene es no cuenta con el capital suficiente, este es el motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, golosinas y jugo.
El gran sueño de Ofelia es que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 33 years old and a single mother of four daughters, whose ages range between two and eleven. This beautiful family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to make an income and provide for her family, Ofelia works buying and selling groceries. She has been doing this for some time, but she also supplements her income by making traditional clothing, which she also sells. 

Lots of people come to Ofelia because she is always kind and helpful with her customers. For this reason, she needs to stock up on products for her store. However, her problem is that she doesn't have enough capital to do this, so she is requesting a loan to invest in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, sweets, and juice.

Ofelia's greatest dream is for her girls to have a professional career one day.

loans.name: Esperanza Viva Group

texts.en:
The five women of this group live in San Antonio Suchitepéquez, Guatemala, a small city known for how it has conserved its indigenous culture. The group is entering its third cycle with Namaste.  These five women have successfully completed two cycles with Namaste during which time they have made much progress and are ready to start a third cycle during which they can grow their businesses even more.  The name of their group comes from the fact that they believe that as long as hope lives in their hearts they will have the strength to do what is necessary to achieve their objectives. One of the women has a small store; one buys and sells firewood; three others sell traditional clothing and various food items.
Doña Olga sells traditional skirts and chocolates on the street.  She is 28 years old with a second grade education.  She is married and has a four-year old daughter.  Her husband has a job and they both contribute to the household. Her long-term dream is to use her profits to have a kitchen in which she can make her chocolates.  She will invest her loan money to buy a supply of blouses and t-shirts, both of which are requested by her clients. She is very grateful to Namaste for what she has learned and the tools she has been given for improving her business.  Namaste provides group classes in financial literacy and a Business Advisor to help her develop and follow a business plan. During the previous two cycles she has attended all the classes and worked diligently with her Business Advisor.
Her current monthly net profit is 1253 Guatemalan Quetzales working 175 hours.  By the end of this nine-month cycle she hopes to have a net profit of Q2378. To achieve this increase she will be selling the new products she will buy with her loan, up her work hours to 200 each month, and follow the continuing advice of her Business Advisor.

loans.use: to buy a supply of blouses and t-shirts, both of which are requested by her clients

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana es madre soltera y tiene 37 años de edad vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 17 y 16 años de edad, además viven con ellos dos tíos. Ana es una mujer luchadora que se dedica  a prestar sus servicios domésticos en una pupusería local lo que le permite llevar el sustento a sus hijos, por lo que se siente feliz con su trabajo. Ana desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, ya que actualmente esta es de tierra lo que está causando enfermedades respiratorias a su familia, pero sobre todo a sus hijos que gustan de jugar en el corredor de la misma, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el corredor de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que no quiere que el próximo invierno dificulte la mejora.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother, 37 years old, who lives with her three children, ages 12, 16, and 17. Also living with them are two uncles.

Ana is a combative woman who provides domestic services in a local restaurant, which enables her to provide for her children. For that reason, she is happy with her work.

Ana wants to cement the floor of her home, which, at present, is bare earth, and causes respiratory illnesses among her family. But, above all, she wants her children to be able to play in the corridor of her home. 

For that reason, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to complete the masonry in the corridor of the home as soon as possible, since she doesn't want the next winter to make things worse.

loans.use: invest in cement, sand, and gravel to finish the masonry work on the corridor in her house and to start covering the earthen floor.

loans.name: Villa Bella Group

texts.es:
Eloysa es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 21 años, y su negocio es la venta de quesillo. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, paciente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Jorochito’ caracterizada por su topografía levemente ondulada y cubierta por vegetación tropical, cuenta con una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre, sitio de acopio de la producción del campo, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Eloysa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la derecha, viste camiseta lila a rayas horizontales). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba. Sus ganas de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos, llantería, venta de huevo, venta de horneados tradicionales, venta de fruta, venta de pañales y venta de pantalones, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de queso; ella se encarga de comprar queso por mayor a los productores lugareños para venderlos al menudeo, por unidad y por peso, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante empujando un carrito de 2 ruedas cargado de queso y una balanza. “El queso es un alimento que muchos no podemos resistirnos a comer, ya que es delicioso para todas las edades, tiene proteínas de alta calidad, equivalentes a las de la carne.” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la gran demanda en todas las épocas del año, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de por mayor. Su sueño es tener una tienda grande dónde pueda vender queso por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de quesos para aumentar su oferta y generar mejores ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos en la institución en 1 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Eloysa solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de queso por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y abrir una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Eloysa is a 42 year old woman who lives with her husband.  She has two children, ages 9 and 21.  her business is the sale of cheese.  She is innovative, independent, patient, friendly, responsible and hardworking.  

Her business developed in Jorochito, characterized by its rolling hills covered by tropical vegetation.  It has rich forestry and wildlife.  There is good agriculture there.  It has a warm tropical climate which is humid.  The temperature is approximately 30 degrees centigrade all year.  

Eloysa has a dark complexion with brown eyes and long black hair which she braids.  She is short with a robust complexion.  Her native tongue is guarani which she speak at home and she also speaks Spanish in public and while working.  (She is standing, far right.) She shares her life with her husband who works in construction.  They live in their own room, made of brick and mortar with a corrugated iron roof.  They have electricity and well water.  

Her desire to better herself brought her to lead a group of people in various businesses such as:  soft drink sales, tire shop, egg sales, oven sales, fruit sales, diaper sales and pants sales.  They are asking for the loan to better their businesses.  

Her business is the sale of cheese.  She purchases cheese wholesale from local producers to sell retail, by unit and by weight.  She does this every day of the week, walking and pushing a two wheel card full of cheese and a scale.  "Cheese is a food that many cannot resist eating.  It is delicious to all ages, it is high in protein, equivalent to meat," she comments.  

The advantage of her business is the great demand year round.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase wholesale.  Her dream is to have a large store where she can sell cheese wholesale.  She hope to be able to purchase a variety of cheeses to increase her offerings and generate better sales.  

This is the first sequence of loans for the institution in the year that they have been developing this activity.  For these motives Eloysa is asking for a loan to purchase the varieties of cheese wholesale to increase her sales an open a large store.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cheeses to increase her sales and open a large store.

texts.es:

German, desde sus 12 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura, tiene mucha experiencia en la realización de estas actividades y tambien tiene algunos cerdos que engorda para vender.

German, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pesticidas para preparar el terreno donde sembrará tres manzanas de maíz y no le alcanza el dinero que tiene, es por eso que solicita la ayuda del crédito.

German, desea cultivar semilla mejorada, para tener mejores ingresos y además ayudarle a sus hijos para que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
German, 40 years old, is married and has three children ages 12, 10 and 7.  All three are studying.  

Ever since German was twelve years old, he has worked in agriculture.  He has a lot of experience in this field and he also has some pigs that he sells.

German needs the loan to purchase compost, fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land where he will plant just over five acres of corn.  The money he has isn't enough, which is why he is asking for the loan.  German wants to grow the best crops in order to have better income.  In this way he can help his children with their studies and on their path to becoming professionals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost and pesticides to prepare the land where he will plant just over five acres of corn.

loans.name: Yasmid Andrea

texts.es:
Yasmid es una mujer de 37 años de edad, se dedico inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo, inicio con un taller de confecciones propio.
 
Es casada y es madre de dos hijos. Hace 10 años es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe ya que es reconocida por su buen servicio al cliente. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina recubridora pues desea aumentar su capacidad de producción, además de que puede generar un empleo adicional.

Su principal sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder sacar su negocio adelante.
texts.en:
Yasmid is a 37 year old woman. Initially, she started working in the sewing business, doing this job for three years as a worker. After this period of time, she started her own sewing business. 
She is married and has two children. For ten years, she has been an independent woman because it is thanks to the micro loans that she has the possibility of being her own boss and generating employment, because her shop is known for her good customer service. 
She is requesting the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, because she wants to increase her production capacity and also generate employment. 
Her biggest dream is to improve the conditions of her house and be able to move her business ahead.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine because she will increase her production capacity, and also generate employment.

loans.name: Margoth Judith

texts.es:
La señora Margoth luego de quedarse sin empleo, inicio a trabajar como recicladora en el municipio de Sincelejo, desde entonces almacena en una bodega los materiales como botellas, cartón, papel, vidrio, entre otros que recoge diariamente y cada que tiene una cantidad bastante grande, la vende a chatarrerías del municipio y las empresas de procesamiento. 

Debido a un incidente que sufrió meses atrás se encuentra con poco capital de trabajo, es por esto que tiene la esperanza de comprar material reciclado al por mayor para recuperar un poco su negocio, el cual le brinda los ingresos mínimos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Margoth started a recycling business in the town of Sincelejo after losing a job. Each day she collects materials such as bottles, cardboard, paper, glass and other recyclables and stores them in a shop. When she's accumulated a sufficient quantity of materials, she sells them to a municipal waste management agency or a processing company. 

The recycling business suffered a setback several months ago that reduced Señora Margoth's working capital. She therefore hopes to purchase recyclable materials wholesale and recover from her recent problems. The recycling business provides a small income that helps meet the needs of Señora Margoth's family.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials wholesale and recover from a recent setback.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sustainable package of solar products that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, leggings, t-shirts, creams, makeup, lotions, deodorant, etc

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, él lleva toda su vida dedicándose a dicha actividad, le gusta la agricultura  porque es un trabajo honrado y de mucho esfuerzo.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para preparar la tierra y comenzar con los trabajos de la milpa. 

Miguel desea que este año le salga bien su cosecha y que pueda recuperarse de todas las pérdidas del año pasado, desea que sus hijos y su familia salgan adelante y tengan una vida feliz.
texts.en:
Miguel, 62 years old, is married and has 7 children, only 5 of whom live with him. Miguel makes his living in agriculture, and has been doing this his whole life. He likes agriculture because it is honorable work and takes a lot of effort.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land and begin working the cornfield. Miguel wants a good harvest this year so that he can recover all the losses from last year. He wants his children and his family to get ahead and to have a happy life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to prepare the land and begin the work of the cornfield.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria tiene 23 años de edad es soltera vive con sus familiares en la parroquia Salinas, provincia de Bolivar, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agricolas para la siembra de papas, gracias al crédito podra mejorar su capital de trabajo, realiza las compras cada 8 dias en Guaranda. Su sueño es tener mucho ganado y mas tierras en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria is 23 years old and is single. She lives with her family in the Salinas parish, Bolivar province.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer for sowing potatoes. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to improve her working capital.

She makes her purchases every week in Guaranda. Her dream is to have a lot of cattle and more land. In her free time, she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Fuentes De Vida Group

texts.es: Matilde es una joven con 28 años de edad, madre de dos hijos y soltera. Es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida, muy trabajadora. Sus 2 niños son menores de edad y una está en preescolar. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio ambulante de ropa y tiene mucha experiencia, ésta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Ahora quiere unirse con sus padres para trabajar también con la producción del queso, debido a que necesita producir más ingresos porque ella también está estudiando, terminando su secundaria. Su meta es superarse, tener un estudio y trabajo estable con el que pueda salir adelante con sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a ésto ella va invertir su préstamo en comprar una vaca lechera. Ella y su grupo han recibido varios créditos anteriormente, y para ésta socia son los financiamientos los que le dieron la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y consolidarlo. El grupo de Matilde está compuesto por 2 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y avicultura.
texts.en:
Matilde, 28, is the single mother of two children.  She's the hardworking treasurer of Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida.  Her two children are minors, and one attends preschool.

She has always earned a living selling clothing as a street vendor, and she has a lot of experience.  This job has allowed her to get her children ahead.  Now she wants to work with her parents in cheese production as well.  She needs to earn more income because she's also attending school so she can finish high school.  Her goal is to improve herself, get an education, and have a stable job with which to get ahead with her children and give them a better quality of life.

As a result, Matilde's going to invest her loan in a dairy cow.

Matilde and her group have received several loans previously, and the loans are what gave this member the opportunity to start and strengthen her own business.  The group is made up of two additional members who are going to invest in commercial activities and poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilian Mabel

texts.es:
Lilian, de 55 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, se crio con su mamá y se acompañó a los 16 años de edad, su compañero de vida falleció hace dos años, tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno vive con ella, ella solo vive con dos nietos.

Lilian, se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote, trabaja desde los 12 años de edad, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió en el negocio de su mamá; ella elabora los tamales por la mañana y sale a venderlos a la ciudad en la tarde, se coloca un huacal de aluminio en la cabeza con los tamales y viaja en microbús. 

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar leña, aceite, azúcar, sal y para comprar una red de elotes cada día, con el préstamo aumentará la venta y tendrá más ganancias para sus gastos.

Ella desea darle la oportunidad de estudiar a su nieto, porque la mamá del niño está pasando por una situación económica bien difícil y no le apoyo lo suficiente económicamente para los gastos del niño.
texts.en:
Lilian, 55 years old, never went to school. She was raised with her mother and was partnered at 16 years old. Her life partner died two years ago. She has 3 children but none of them live with her. She only lives with two grandchildren. 

Lilian works selling corn tamales, work she has done since she was 12 years old. Everything she knows, she learned in her mother's business. She makes the tamales in the morning and goes out to sell them in the city in the afternoon. She puts an aluminum container on her head with the tamales and travels by bus.

She needs the loan to purchase firewood, oil, sugar, salt and to purchase corn every day. With the loan, she will increase her sales and will have more earnings for her expenses.

She wants to provide her grandson with the opportunity to go to school because the boy's mother is going through a very difficult economic situation and doesn't support him enough to cover the boy's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, oil, sugar and salt and to purchase corn each day.

loans.name: De Paz Group

texts.en:
The gorgeous Department of Sololá is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. One of the most beautiful lakes in the world — Lake Atitlán — is located here. Along its shores is Santiago Atitlán, which draws tourists from around the world because of the colorful and unique textiles that are created here. The Tz'utujil speaking Maya are very fond of birds and flowers which they embroider exquisitely on their huipiles (blouses).

“De Paz” (of Peace), a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, is located in Santiago Atitlán. There are eight very active members of the Trust Bank. The women say the loans they have received have been very supportive of the growth and stability of their businesses. They have seen their inventories increase, which means increased income that benefits their household needs.

Micaela is the president of “De Paz.” She is 47 years old, widowed and has seven children. When her husband died seven years ago, she became the sole support of her family, and without an education, it was difficult. However, thanks to her business of buying and selling scarves, typical bedspreads, embroidered blouses, belts and beaded jewelry, she has been able to make ends meet. 

Micaela is seeking credit to buy a larger variety of typical items like bedspreads and huipiles (blouses). Her dream is to expand her business more in order to provide an inheritance for her children that will keep providing for generations to come. 

Micaela reports that the “Microcredit Plus” program of non‐formal education that Friendship Bridge provides has been very beneficial in helping her to invest her money wisely so that income from her business grows and meets the needs of her family.

“De Paz” thanks the lenders of Kiva and the Friendship Bridge for their support in helping to provide sustainable business development to their community of Santiago Atitlán!

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of typical items like bedspreads and huipiles (blouses)

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 23 years old, married with one child.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, home care products and other groceries.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mildred aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Adelaida is 39 years old.

Adelaida has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks for her business.

Adelaida has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks for her business weaving panels for roof construction

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julieta is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for five years. In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 57 years old and married with one child.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries.

Aida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Aida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, junk foods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marites is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marites has a buy-&-sell nipa (woven roofing panels) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks, leaves, etc.

Marites has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks, leaves, etc

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabel is 55 years old now.

Annabel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annabel requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Annabel has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Annabel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Azeneth

texts.en:
Azeneth is 35 years old and widowed with six children.

Azeneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Azeneth has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Azeneth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, personal product care and other groceries to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 42 years old and has five children. Edelyn is single and has one child in school.

Edelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edelyn requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock and to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is 42 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Bernie works very hard to provide for them.

Bernie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, canned goods, school supplies, personal product care and other groceries.

Bernie has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Bernie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, canned goods, school supplies, personal product care etc. to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Cladia

texts.en:
Cladia is 64 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Cladia works very hard to provide for them.

Cladia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, personal product care and other groceries.

Cladia has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Cladia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, personal product care and other groceries and to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy all kinds of beverages to sell for her buy and sell beverages business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of beverages to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, personal product care and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying painting equipment to offer this service.

loans.name: Marinela

texts.es:
Marinela, una persona emprendedora desde siempre, quien ha emprendido varios negocios con el fin de encontrar una sostenibilidad económica y sobre todo poder dedicar su tiempo a su esposo, está incursionando en el mundo de la belleza con sus servicios a domicilios de cepillado, maquillaje, arreglo de uñas, etc. Con el cual ha generado ingresos para sostener su hogar.

Espera crecer mucho más su negocio, en un futuro poder tener su propio local de belleza y posicionarse en el mercado de un forma segura.

Su dificultad más grande es la inseguridad en el sector donde trabaja

El crédito será utilizado para adecuar y arreglar el local al cual quiere trasladarse y formar su negocio allí.
texts.en:
Marinela has always been an enterprising person and has started various businesses with the goal of finding economic stability and, above all, the ability to dedicate time to her husband. She is entering the beauty world with her home services of hairstyling, make up, nails, etc., which has earned her the income to maintain her household.

She wants to grow her business much more and have her own beauty shop to securely position herself in the market. Her biggest difficulty is the insecurity of the sector in which she works.

The loan will be used to adapt and fix up the location where she wants to move and establish her business.

loans.use: to adapt and fix up the location where she wants to move and establish her business

loans.name: Yudis Maria

texts.es:
Yudis se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como una mujer amable y carismática, con 33 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de dulces que comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena ubicación, pues se encuentra en el parque principal del municipio donde reside. 

Su experiencia en ventas la obtuvo trabajando de manera empírica, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de comercio es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de dulces y confitería, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es comprar vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos (Ver Foto una de sus hijas) una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yudis would be characterized by her customers as an amiable and charismatic woman. She is 33 years old and runs her own business selling sweets which she began approximately three years ago. She has the advantage of having a very good location in the main park of the municipality where she lives. Her sales experience has been gained empirically, and her business understanding has been amplified. 

The loan she requests would aid in purchasing supplies to improve her sweets and confections. This will allow her to offer her customers more variety to satisfy their different tastes and preferences; which would generate greater sales and revenue so that she can continue fighting to achieve her mid-term goal of buying a house to share with her family. The loan would also help her business achieve greater profits that will give her children better quality of life. In the photo you can see one of her daughters.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to increase her inventory of sweets and confections.

loans.name: Elvira Rosa

texts.es: Elvira de 47 años de edad, es una apasionada por la belleza y el cuidado personal, aprendió este arte desde muy joven a sus 14 años de edad, trabajando en el salón de belleza de su tío.   Tiempo después, viajo al Perú y estuvo empleada tres años consecutivos como estilista en salones de belleza,  en donde adquirió la experiencia necesaria para volver a Colombia como una experta en la estética.  Desde entonces con unos ahorros y la ayuda de una hermana, ofrece a domicilio sus servicios. Con una clientela fidelizada a quienes satisface sus necesidades, mediante servicios de excelente calidad y confianza, Elvira se mantiene en constante capacitación para ofrecer tratamientos de belleza a la vanguardia como keratinas, así mismo realiza cortes de cabello, blower, pedicure y manicure.  Con la finalidad de inaugurar su propio Salón de Belleza, ella ha solicitado un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en sillas de peluquería, espejos, mesas, lava cabezas y demás accesorios de peluquería.  Elvira es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad y su meta es organizar su salón de belleza desde su casa; ella considera que esta inversión le permitirá ser más eficiente, gracias a que en un punto fijo de atención podrá ampliar su cobertura de clientes.
texts.en: Elvira is 47 years old. She is passionate about beauty and personal care. She learned this art since very young, at 14 years of age by working in her uncle's beauty salon. Some time later, she traveled to Peru and worked three consecutive years as a stylist in beauty salons, where she got the needed experience to return to Colombia as an esthetics expert. Since then, with some savings and the help of her sister, she offers home hairdressing services. With a loyal customer base, whom she keeps satisfied through excellent service, Elvira keeps on constantly educating herself in order to offer fashionable beauty treatments such as keratin, haircuts, blowing, pedicure and manicure. With the purpose of opening her own beauty salon, she has requested a Credikiva, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in beauty salon chairs, mirrors, tables, head washing basins and other hair salon accessories. Elvira is the mother of two older children, and her goal is to organize her beauty salon in her house. She thinks this investment will allow her to be more efficient, thanks to the fact that at a fixed place of service she will be able to have more customers.

loans.use: to invest in hair salon chairs, mirrors, tables, head washing basins and other hair salon accessories.

loans.name: Doralba

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Doralba es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.

Ella prepara y vende comidas en su cafetería en el municipio de Argelia, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja sola durante 3 horas en semana y 10 horas los fines de semana.

El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima como carne, harina, entre otros, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Doralba's perseverance and courage those in her household can live with dignity.  She prepares and sells meals in her cafeteria in 
Argelia municipality.  She started this work in an effort to bring in new income to support her family.  Her husband and children are her greatest motivation to work everyday and to try and make everyday better. 
She works alone 3 hours during the week and 10 hours on the weekend. She hopes to boost her business by buying supplies and raw materials such as meat and flour, etcetera.  The Corporación Interactuar and loans from Kiva can give it that boost. With these elements she can always have food ready for her clients. Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant in the same area so she doesn't lose her clients.

loans.use: To buy supplies and raw materials such as meat and flour, etcetera.

loans.name: José Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se encarga de los oficios de la casa, tienen 2 hijos, pero todos tienen sus propias familias.

Moisés, es agricultor desde hace 15 años, aprendió este trabajo gracias a su padre, también tiene una pequeña tienda, antes solo sembraba maíz, su lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos desde su casa y viaja en carreta, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta que termina la jornada del día.

Moises, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, semilla para sembrar, fertilizantes y otros productos.
Sus sueños son, comprar una vaca para vender leche y que sus cultivos sean productivos.
texts.en:
Jose Moisés is 65 years old and studied until the 6th grade.  He is married and his wife is in charge of the household chores, they have 2 children but they all now have their own families. 

Jose has been a farmer for 15 years, he leant from his father. He also has a small shop. Jose's house and he travels there via lace of work is only 10 minutes away from his and he travels there via a wagon. His working house are from 6am until the working day ends. 

Jose needs the loan to buy supplies, seeds and fertilizer amongst other things. His dreams are to buy a cow so he can sell milk and that he has productive cultivations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other products

loans.name: Héctor Alejandro

texts.es:
Héctor es un padre de familia de 30 años, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 6 años, esta hermosa familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Héctor con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como policía municipal de tránsito, él tiene 6 años de ejercer esta labor.
Héctor desde hace algún tiempo estaba construyendo su casa que gracias a Dios ahora solo le hace falta colocarles puertas y ventas, pero ahora él ya no tiene las posibilidades para poder comprar lo necesario, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad.
El sueño de Héctor es poder construirle una casa a cada uno de sus hijos y darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Héctor is a father of a family and is 30 years old.  He is married, and he has a lovely family of two children between the ages of 4 and 6.  This beautiful family lives in a community of Sololá.  Héctor, with an eagerness to make income and get his family ahead, works as a municipal transportation police officer.  He has worked in this job for six years.

Héctor for some time was working on his house, that thanks to God, now only lacks putting in the doors and windows.  But now he does not have the possibilities to be able to buy what he needs.  This is why he is requesting a loan to cover this need.

Héctor's dream is to be able to build a house for each of his children and give them a good education.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Srinivasmurthy

texts.en:
Srinivasmurthy is 43 years old and lives in Siddanahundi Village in Mysore District, Karnataka. He is married and has two school-going children. After completing his B.A. he was very  much interested in agriculture and he started practicing agriculture vigorously.  He started experimenting with new things in agriculture and learnt lot out of it, and he preached it to farmers  in his village with the help of training materials. This received good response from the farmers. He also started to support other people who provide training to farmers.  

Srinivasmurthy is now seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a projector, so that he can modernize his existing training and contribute to technical developments.

loans.use: to buy a projector

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make a large water basin to store water.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lorena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business and to save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 34 years old and married with seven children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cell phone case, home product care and other items.

Jenalyn has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jenalyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cell phone case, home product care and other items to save to be able to send her children to college

loans.name: Wilson Anibal

texts.es: Anibal es un joven trabajador que tiene 26 años de edad,  crecio en el campo y vive con su madre y hermanos menores que estan estudiando, Anibal se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura desde hace 8 años atrás y de esta forma aprendio como se cultiva los productos que son propios de su provincia. Anibal vive en una casa humilde y junto a su familia trabaja en el campo para obtener sus recursos. Anibal necesita el dinero del credito para comprar abono y fungicidas para cuidar  sus cultivos y asi obtener una buena cosecha y vender sus productos a buen precio. Anibal comenta que las personas que viven en en campo no tiene muchas posibilidades de continuar sus estudio secundarios pero Anibal tiene la aspiracon de segir trabajando  y apoyar a sus hermanos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en: Anibal is a 26 year old hardworking young man. He grew up in the countryside and lives with his mother and younger siblings, who go to school. Anibal has worked for eight years as a day laborer in farming jobs, and in this way he learned to cultivate the local products of his province. Anibal lives in a modest house, and together with his family he works in the fields to obtain his resources. Anibal needs the loan money to buy manure and fungicides to take care of his crops, and in this way obtain a good harvest and sell his products at a good price. Anibal comments that the people who live in the countryside do not have many chances to continue with high school education, but Anibal wishes to keep on working and supporting his siblings so they continue studying.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Elzo Bolívar

texts.es:
El señor Elzo es un emprendedor de 60 años es viudo. Trabaja comprando y vendiendo toda clase frutas, en su domicilio  tiene un pequeño invernadero con sembríos de hortalizas, junto a el tiene sembríos de cacao y árboles frutales. Espera cosechar los frutos y sacar a la venta, también se dedica a cuidar y limpiar terrenos de sus familiares. Sus 8 hijos son mayores de edad e independientes viven en la ciudad de Quito.

Don Elzo vive y trabaja en el Recinto San Bernabé el cual pertenece a San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor con un clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición se realizan las fiestas de este Recinto en el mes de septiembre, una de las actividades en la cual participa toda la comunidad es la caminata que inicia desde la Iglesia Matríz de los Bancos a las 20h00 y culmina en San Bernabé a las 06h00 de la mañana con la misa en honor a su Patrono Bernabé de Larraúl, en la noche se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo, la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes.
Solicita este crédito para fortalecer su negocio compra y venta de frutas y también para sembrar naranjilla, aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida ya que tiene mucha acogida en los distintos sectores.
El señor Elzo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda que le brindan para fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Elzo is a 60-year-old entrepreneur who is a widower. He works buying and selling all sorts of fruits. In his house he has a small greenhouse with vegetables sown along with cocoa and fruit trees. He hopes to harvest the fruits and sell them, and also he works caring for and cleaning his relatives' land. His 8 children are adults and independent and live in the city of Quito. 

Elzo lives and works in the rural settlement of San Bernabé, which is part of San Miguel de los Bancos, the Canton of Love, with its warm humid climate, which has various restful places which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. As a tradition, they have this settlement's festivals in September, one of the activities in which the whole community participates is the walk that begins from the Matríz de los Bancos church which begins at 8:00 pm and ends at San Bernabé at 6:00 in the morning with a mass in honor of their patron saint Barnabé de Larraúl. At night, they do traditional dances and the famous "castle burning". The people of this canton are very friendly and peaceful with all their visitors.
