He asks for this loan to strengthen his business buying and selling fruit and also to plant naranjillas. He learned this work through this own initiative. With this investment, he hopes to increase his income and improve his quality of life since he is welcomed in the different sectors.

Elzo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the help that they offer him to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to plant naranjilla fruits.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha se encuentra ubicado el Cantón Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo con gente que lucha día a día por superarse. Este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos varios sitios de descanso y distracción, hay muchas hosterías en las que se puede pasar momentos agradables en familia. A unos pocos minutos de este Cantón en el Recinto la Célica vía entrada Río Pescador vive y tiene el negocio el señor Miguel, un hombre luchador de 49 años. Es soltero no tiene hijos casi toda su vida vivió con los papás y ayudándolos en la finca, actualmente es independiente tiene su propia finca en la misma tiene ganado y se dedica a la producción de leche.
Aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papás, entre el empleo como jornalero que en ocasiones realiza y el negocio trabaja un promedio de 8 horas por día, solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio y poder comprar dos vacas lecheras, con esta inversión mejorara la producción de leche, el señor Miguel está pensando en pronto formar un hogar y tener hijos, por ese motivo quiere que sus ingresos económicos mejoren, Don Miguel agradece a Fundación Alternativa y Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
To the northwest of Pichincha, the canton of Pedro Vicente Maldonado can be found. The weather is warm and humid here, and the people strive everyday to better themselves. Also in this canton, many tourists visit from other areas in Ecuador as well as from abroad, since there are various places for relaxation and diversion nearby. There are many hotels where one can spend time with family as well. 

A few minutes from this area, in the Recinto Célica by way of the Río Pescador, lives Señor Miguel who has a business. Miguel is a fighter. He is 49 years old, and he is single with no children. For nearly all of his life, he has lived with his parents and helped them on their ranch. Currently, he is independent and he has his own ranch in the area. He has livestock, and makes a living producing milk.

Miguel learned this business in his childhood together with his parents. Between his occasional work as a day laborer and this business, Miguel works on average 8 hours a day. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business by purchasing two dairy cows. With this investment, his milk production will improve. Señor Miguel is thinking of starting a family shortly and having children. For this reason, he wants to earn more income. Don Miguel thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows and increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace the old lofts of the chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 19 years old who lives with her partner and their child. She used to live in a rancho (rural community) when she was a girl. Patricia learned how to plant corn and the whole process for making tortillas. In order to make a profit and cover her college expenses Patricia began selling tortillas prepared by hand with organic corn to her acquaintances. 
Today she runs her business in her home but she wants to take her business into a formal establishment and open several tortillerías in other regions. Patricia is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy a mill to grind corn and ingredients in order to prepare tortillas. 
Patricia is a strong and positive woman, a fighter who pursues the happiness of her child more than her own. For that reason she never gives up, even when she has many orders she enjoys every moment of her work. Everyday she shares unforgettable experiences with customers but sometimes customers ask her to make the whole process she carried out for making tortillas, so Patricia feels very happy about customers' satisfaction. 
With this loan she will be able to improve the production increasing incomes with which will make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy a mill to grind corn and ingredients in order to prepare tortillas.

loans.name: Relampago Group

texts.es:
El estado de Oaxaca es una de las entidades que cuentan con la presencia de World Vision, institución humanitaria que pertenece a la misma confraternidad de World Vision. De esta manera las familias se ven beneficiadas con los proyectos en conjunto, mientras que los niños forman parte de los programas de patrocinio. 

   Relámpago es un grupo formado por once  habitantes con la intención de aprovechar las oportunidades que sus actividades les ofrecen. El nombre hace referencia a la rapidez que esperan tener para alcanzar sus metas. Los integrantes son: Elba quien vende postres, hielitos, dulces; Maricruz, comida; Olga, perfumes; Virginia, refrescos; Juan Daniel, pollos asados; Agueda, perfumes; Liliana, dulces; Josefina, carne de cerdo; Yareli, carne enchilada. Por su lado Delfina y María manejan una tienda de abarrotes.

   Juan es mejor conocido como Juancho, está casado con Anayeli y tienen un pequeño hijo de cuatro años que recibe el patrocinio de Wold Vision por lo cual se sienten muy afortunados. 
   Para complementar su labor como cortador de caña, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes, Juancho ha emprendido la venta de pollos asados al carbón los fines de semana. Debajo de una lona de plástico coloca su asador junto a una mesa con ingredientes y utensilios indispensables y una hielera que mantiene fresco el producto para después cocinarlo con su sazón único. Su esposa lo ayuda en todo momento de tal manera que sus clientes siempre se retiran satisfechos con su compra. 
   Con el propósito de seguir su ascenso Juan invertirá el préstamo en papas cambray y treinta pollos en pluma. “El primer fin de semana vendí quince pollos y para el próximo fin me han solicitado veinte" comenta muy contento Juancho quien ha iniciado con el pie derecho y ya planea tener un local para vender más pollos asados. "Con el apoyo de mi familia y la gracia de Dios lo lograré”. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de doña Elba, Juan es el único hombre en el grupo. La fotografía se tomó por la noche puesto que, por sus actividades, los clientes no pueden reunirse más temprano.
texts.en:
The state of Oaxaca is one of the entities with the presence of the World Vision humanitarian institution, which belongs to the World Vision network.  This way, the families are benefited with joint projects while the children are part of the sponsorship programs.

Relámpago is a group comprised of eleven inhabitants who intend to take advantage of the opportunities that their business activities offer them.  The name refers to the rapid way they hope to achieve their goals.  The members are:  Elba, who sells desserts, frozen treats, and sweets; Maricruz sells food; Olga sells perfume, Virginia sells refreshments; Juan Daniel sells roast chicken; Agueda sells perfume, Liliana sells candy; Josefina sells pork; and Yareli sells meat enchiladas.  Delfina and María manage a grocery store.

Juan is better known as Juancho.  He is married to Anayeli, and they have a little four year old son who is receiving World Vision sponsorship.  They feel very fortunate about this.

In order to complement his work cutting sugar cane, an activity he engages in on Mondays through Fridays, Juancho has undertaken selling charcoal roasted chicken on the week-ends.  He places his rotisserie under plastic sheeting at a table with ingredients and indispensable utensils, and he has a cooler that keeps the product fresh after cooking it with his original flavoring.  His wife helps him all of the time in such a way that the customers always go away happy with their purchase.

With the intention of continuing to move up, Juan will use the loan to buy new potatoes and 30 live chickens.  "The first week-end I sold 15 chickens, and I had orders for 20 for the following week-end,” Juancho says very happily.  He has started off on the right foot, and he now plans to have a place to sell more roasted chickens.  “With the support of my family and God’s grace, I will do it.”

*The photograph was taken on the patio of Elba’s house.  Juan is the only man in the group.  The photograph was taken at night because, due to their business activities, the members were not able to get together earlier.

loans.use: to buy new potatoes and 30 live chickens.

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMEDIO, ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lina has a buy and sell lemon business in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of lemon to sell in the market.

Lina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of lemons to sell in the market and expand her business for the future of the family

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Maribeth has a buy and sell processed food business in the Philippines. Maribeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more processed food to sell.

Maribeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more processed food to sell and save to send her children to college

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, persoanl product care, home product care and other groceries.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from manicure and pedicure.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, personal product care, home product care and other groceries and to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liberty is 44 years old and has one child in school.

Liberty has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liberty requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Liberty has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Liberty would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old with seven children. With two children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college..

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, canned goods, personal product care and other groceries to save in order to send her children to college

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, no estudio, debido a que sus padres no se preocupaban por que ella aprendiera a leer y escribir, actualmente está asistiendo a un programa de alfabetización, donde jóvenes de su comunidad le están enseñando a leer y a escribir, está casa y su esposo se dedica a cuidar terrenos y ganado de una persona de su comunidad, con quien trabaja desde hace 10 años, su trabajo consiste en limpiar los potreros, alimentar la vacas y cambiarlas de potrero.

María, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo en fincas, sus responsabilidades eran  ollar, podar, abonar y cortar el café y era de ese trabajo que mantenía toda la familia.

María, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sembrar maíz y frijoles, esos son los granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero lo que más le interesa es que su familia tenga ganado y terrenos donde puedan trabajar de manera propia.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She did not go to school because her parents did not worry about whether or not she learned to read and write. Currently, she is attending a literacy program, where young adults in her community are teaching her to read and write.

She is married, and her husband makes a living taking care of the land and livestock that belong to a person from their community. He has been working there for the past 10 years, and his job consists of cleaning the pastures, feeding the cows, and changing their pastures.

Maria previously worked performing farm work. Her responsibilities were trimming, fertilizing, and cutting coffee crops. With this work, she supported her entire family. 

Maria needs a loan to buy compost and fertilizer in order to plant corn and beans, which are the basic grains that are used by families as nourishment. She has many dreams, but more than anything she wants her family to have livestock and land where they can work on their own.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer in order to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Belinda De Los Angeles

texts.es: A sus 29 años de edad Belinda ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su esposo y su hermano, con este apoyo ha logrado establecer su propia pulpería y poco a poco irla abasteciendo con diversos productos. Siempre con las ganas de salir adelante en esta ocasión solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, jugos, golosinas y productos de aseo personal. De esta manera podrá obtener diversos ingresos y podrá ampliar su pulpería.
texts.en:
At 29 years of age, Belinda has been able to get ahead with the help of her spouse and her brother. With this help she has started her own convenience store and little by little is supplying it with various products. 

With the intention of continuing to get ahead she is now asking for a loan to purchase basic grains, juices, snacks and personal hygiene products. In this way she will be able to obtain varied income and will be able to improve her convenience store.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, juices, snacks and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Oscar Polivio

texts.es:
A diez minutos de San Miguel de los Bancos tenemos el Recinto San Pedro un lugar con gente muy  humilde y  luchadora. En este recinto vive y trabaja el señor Oscar en la finca de su jefe, tiene una relación de unión libre con la señora Dolores con la que ha procreado 5 hijos todos menores de edad, por ellos lucha cada día buscando superarse en todo lo que pueda para tratar de que no les falte nada la familia se ayuda cada día en las labores de campo son muy unidos y el señor Oscar es un ejemplo a seguir. 
En su vida ha tenido varios obstáculos uno de ellos fue no poder culminar sus estudios tiene únicamente educación primaria. 
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es que todos sus hijos tengan una profesión por ese motivo desea emprender este negocio que es la crianza de toretes además cuenta con el apoyo de su jefe el cual también le motiva y decidió facilitarle un espacio de su finca para que emprenda el negocio, con esto logrará mejorar sus ingresos económicos podrá cumplir sus sueños y darle a su familia un mejor futuro. 
El señor Oscar agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
El Recinto San Pedro is ten minutes outside of San Miguel de los Bancos. It is a place with very humble and hard working people.  Mr. Oscar lives and works there on his employer's ranch.  He has a domestic partnership with Ms. Dolores with whom he has had 5 children, who are all minors. It is for them that he works to do everything he can to see that all their needs are met.  The family helps with the outside work everyday.  They are a very close knit family and Mr. Oscar is an example to follow. 

In his lifetime he has faced many obstacles. One was not being able to finish school. He only went to elementary school. He has many dreams that he would like to see become reality. One of them is for all of his children to have a profession. That is why he wants to start the business of raising young bulls.  He also has the support of his employer who encourages him and has decided to give him an area on his ranch to start the business. With it he will be able to improve his income, realize his dreams and give his family a better future. Mr. Oscar Guerrero thanks the Fundación Alternativa (Alternative Foundation) and Kiva for the support and opportunity given to him to improve his quality of life and realize his dreams.

loans.use: To start raising young bulls.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Kadiatou est la personne qui est entrain de donner à manger au mouton.
Elle est Malienne âgée de 23 ans, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants qui n’ont pas l’âge d’être scolarisé.
Ces enfants sont âgés de 1 à 5 ans vivant tous dans le milieu rural. Elle n’est pas instruite.
Pour gagner sa vie elle fait l’embouche ovine il ya 4 ans de cela.
Son mari (époux) fait le commerce de pièces détachées, le maraichage avec l’embouche bovine pour le soutien de sa famille.
Elle fait recourt à l’IMF pour soutenir son activité d’embouche ovine.
Le fond qu’elle reçoit du RMCR est investi dans son activité d’embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons maigre dans les marchés locaux  avec de l’aliment bétails, le son du mil, le sel, des médicaments. Après avoir engraissé ses moutons elle les revend dans les mêmes marchés locaux.
Son bénéfice prévisionnel mensuellement est de 18000FCFA.
Avec le revenu elle achète d’autres moutons pour son avenir et celle des enfants surtout leur scolarisation.
Mais souvent le traitement des moutons malade n’est pas facile.
Pour améliorer son activité elle veut avoir beaucoup d’argent.
texts.en:
Kadiatou is the person who is feeding the sheep. She comes from Mali, is 23 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are not yet old enough to attend school. Her children are 1 and 5 years old and live in the countryside. Kadiatou herself did not get an education. In order to earn her living she has been raising sheep for four years. 

Her husband sells spare parts and does market gardening, together with raising cattle to support the family. 

Kadiatou turned to the Microfinance Institution [RMCR] to support her sheep-raising business. The funds that she receives from RMCR are invested in her business raising sheep. She buys thin sheep in the local markets together with livestock feed, millet bran, salt, and medicines. After having fattened her sheep, she resells them in the same local markets. Her expected monthly profit is 18,000 F CFA. With the income she will buy other sheep for her future and that of the children, especially for their school fees. But often treating sick sheep is not easy. To improve her business she wants to have a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy sheep, livestock feed, and millet bran to fatten them

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Teodora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Teodora is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell and secure the future of her family

loans.name: Pureza

texts.en:
Pureza is 54 years old and single. She works very hard.

Pureza runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and groceries.

Pureza has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 30 years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development training. 

She practices vegetable farming where she grows and sells vegetables. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy certified vegetable seeds and fertilizers so as increase vegetables production.  This will enable her increase her income hence be able to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy certified vegetable seeds and fertilizers to increase vegetables production for increased income hence pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Karla Ivonne

texts.en:
Karla Ivonne is 25 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter. In order to offer the best living conditions to her children, for 6 years she had ran a business selling handbags and cosmetics. Karla plans to open a boutique and turn her business into a formal setting to increase sales. Karla would like a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy products in large quantities at a better price such as handbags, makeup and lipsticks and pay local’s rent.  She has a vision of running a grocery store when having greater financial stability. 
This loan will allow her to make inventory and expand her customers' data base. Karla Ivonne will be very grateful if lenders support her business to keep growing. She considers very responsible when managing credits so she will be in time with repayment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy handbags, makeup and lipsticks and pay local's rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron bars, and labor to build a medium-height wall.

loans.name: Pacesa

texts.es:
Pacesa es una mujer de 48 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 12 años y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pacajes Caluyo’ donde los jueves y domingo desde las 08.00 hasta las 19.00 al menos siete calles son ocupadas por los comerciantes, cerca de 45 asociaciones de comerciantes que cuentan con una autorización para vender en las calzadas y aceras. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/12 grados centígrados.
Pacesa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas del tipo ‘llauchas’; estas empanadas se caracterizan por estar rellenas de una masa gelatinosa a base de queso y se acostumbra a comerlas a primera hora de la mañana y calientes. Son aproximadamente las 7 de la mañana y ella ya se encuentra en la calle empujando su carrito de 2 ruedas donde se encuentran 4 canastas cubiertas y envueltas en papel para que no se enfríe el contenido que son las llauchas y que los clientes acostumbran a comerlas calientes, llega a su puesto de venta y espera pacientemente a que los clientes lleguen, pocas horas después se acaba toda su comida. “empecé como vendedora, luego aprendí a hornear la receta y me dedique a vender mi propia producción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos que acostumbran a comer sus empanadas a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos para aumentar su oferta. Su sueño es abrir un tienda de venta de todo tipo de empanas, ella desea invertir en la compra de insumos de cocina como harina, leche, huevos, levadura, queso, etc., para aumentar su producción y llegar a más clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 21 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Pacesa solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para la elaboración de llauchas para abrir una tienda de empanadas.
texts.en:
Pacesa is 48 years old, single, with one son aged 12 and one daughter aged 10. Her business is selling empanadas.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, independent, steadfast, patient, responsible, and very hardworking. She does business in the 'Pacajes Caluyo' area, where on Thursday and Sunday from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM there are at least seven streets filled with vendors, nearly 45 traders associations authourized to sell in the streets and on the sidewalks. The climate is cold and dry, and the temperature varies during the day from -1 to 12 degrees Celsius.

Pacesa has a dark complexion and brown eyes. She wears her long black hair in a braid and is of short stature with a robust physique. Her style of dressing is traditional (a hat, shawl, and skirt) and her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in general situations and in her work.  She shares her life with her children, who are in school. They all live in a room that belongs to the family, made of brick and cememnt with a corrugated metal roof, that has drinking water, electricity and sewage disposal. Her business is selling 'llaucha' empanadas; these are empanadas filled with a gelatinous cheese-based mixture, which are normally eaten hot at the beginning of the morning. 

At about 7 in the morning, Pacesa can already be found in the street, pushing her two-wheeled cart. Inside are four baskets, covered and wrapped in paper so that their contents, the llaucha empanadas, won't get cold and the customers can eat them hot. She arrives at her spot and waits patiently for the customers to arrive, and a few short hours later, all of the food has been finished. "I started as a seller, and later learned to bake the recipe and started selling my own cooking..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular clients who are used to eating her empanadas every day. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy supplies to increase her wares. Her dream is to open a store and sell all kinds of empanadas. She wants to invest in the purchase of cooking supplies like flour, milk, eggs, yeast, cheese, etc. so she can increase her production and reach more clients. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 21 years that she has been doing this work.

These are the reasons that Pacesa is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies for making llaucha empanadas in order to open an empanada store.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for making llaucha empanadas in order to open an empanada store

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is grateful that she was granted a 25000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 50000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Gemalyn dreams of having a bigger General Store. She prays that God will prosper her endeavors to give her family a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Teresita is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more vegetable to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en: Maria Dolores is 47 years old single woman. Besides her work as an assistant in a company, a year ago she started a business selling cosmetics from catalogs to earn an extra income. She plans to run another business of homemade cookies in the coming months. Maria Dolores’ positive attitude is what had led her to be very successful and her customers feel confident in buying her products. Maria Dolores always share her happiness and would like all customers feel good to use the products and convey the same happiness as she does. She is requesting a loan of MXN 3,000 to buy cosmetics to stock. Maria Dolores likes helping people and for that reason she offers an installment payment plan. She will be very grateful if lenders support her with this business, which allows her to have an extra income in order to continue growing professionally. This is Maria Dolores' first loan with Konfío, she is confident in her financial planning skills in order to make successful repayments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to stock

loans.name: Tinovimbanaye Group

texts.en:
Edith is a member of (Tinovimbanaye) group meaning we trust in God in the local language. She is a widowed mother of 4 school going children and is a tenant in a high density suburb of Harare. Edith and her other group members joined Thrive microfinance in August 2014 and they received business advice from Thrive which they said were very helpful to them. Edith and her group members received a combined loan of $1000 dollars, which she said she used her portion of the loan amount to buy jerseys, tracksuits and school uniforms from the local firm in Willowvale textiles and sell them at her flea market in the Harare CBD.

Edith and her group members are very appreciative for the loan they received, since it helps them to improve their lives and they have applied for another loan amounting to $1050 which she said she wants to use her portion of the loan amount to increase her stock of school jerseys they are now approaching the winter season and the demand for jerseys will be high.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sweaters and school uniforms ahead of the cold season.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Yanoko Village. Isah joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isah will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isah now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Zabida

texts.en: Zabida is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji Village. Zabida  joined Babban Gona to improve the life of her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Zabida will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Zabida now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to buy a maize grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en: Maria Margarita is 48 years old, she lives with her husband and daughters. In order to support her household expenses and improve her family's quality of life, for the past two years she has worked selling sodas, beverages, vegetables, milk, cheese, bread and  snacks such as potato chips in her own grocery store. She would like a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy products in bulk so she can get better prices to make inventory in order to increase sales. As an independent and hard-working woman, she has the desire to leave a legacy to her family and wants her children to be proud of their heritage. She wants to expand to the entire state with several branches in order to gain financial stability. The best part of her job is to see customers’ smile, who feel confidence to buy her products. Maria Margarita will be very grateful to those who support her to continue growing. With this loan she will be able to increase incomes with which will make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy products in bulk at a better price

loans.name: Laura Daniela

texts.en: Laura Daniela is 28 years old who lives with her husband and children. In addition to her job as a restaurant manager, for six months she had ran a business selling tacos, hamburgers and hotdogs. She would like a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy kitchen utensils and sauce containers as well as cover operative expenses. Her dream is to have some financial stability and see her children develop professionally with the best education they can get. Laura Daniela is very persistent and always sees the results of her work. She is happy to see clients' satisfaction in the services she offers. With this loan, she will earn a higher income to come closer to her goal of expanding to the entire state with several branches and to be able to make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and cover operative expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a solar power solution for her current business which will increase her income

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Amigas” lo integran cuatro personas que mantienen una buena relación de amistad, ese es el motivo del nombre. Don José que pretenden invertir su préstamo en la cría y engorda de borregos; Tomasa y Alejandra, en su florería y Alicia, en la venta de calzado. 
  Alicia es una persona apreciada en su comunidad debido a su actitud positiva y por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, todos la conocen como Ali. Tiene tres hijos con su pareja Damián quienes continúan sus estudios. 
 Como mujer activa y emprendedora, actualmente maneja tres negocios: venta de ropa, venta de zapatos y una estética. Su hija le ayuda en el negocio mientra ella dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo al estilismo y de esta forma no dejan de atender todas las actividades.
   Fue la venta de zapato lo que hizo que Ali pudiera iniciar los otros negocios, así poco a poco, con sus ganancias y esfuerzo fue adecuando el salón de belleza. Finalmente, pudo costear un curso de estilismo profesional, que como resultado devino en el salón de belleza. 
   Para continuar avanzando hacia adelante, Ali desea invertir el préstamo en calzado, sobre en botas para la temporada de frío. El mayor sueño que tiene es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios profesionales. 

*La fotografía se tomó aun lado del quiosco municipal de donde son originarios los integrantes; Ali viste un suéter negro.
texts.en:
The group "Las Amigas" (The Friends) is comprised of four people who maintain a good friendship, hence the group's name. Jose will invest their loan in raising and fattening lambs; Tomasa and Alejandra will invest in their flower shop, and Alicia will invest in selling footwear. 
Alicia is a person who is very appreciated in her community because of her positive attitude and for being a very hardworking woman, everyone calls her Ali. She has three children with her partner Damian, they are still in school. 
As an active, enterprising woman, right now she is running three businesses: selling clothing, selling shoes, and a beauty salon. Her daughter helps her with the businesses while she spends most of her time working as a stylist, and in that way she can attend to all of her activities. 
It was selling footwear that allowed Ali to start the other businesses, and little by little, with her earnings and efforts, she developed her beauty salon. Finally, she was able to take a course in professional styling, which resulted in the beauty salon. 
To continue moving ahead, Ali would like to invest the loan in footwear, especially boots for the cold season. Her greatest dream is that her children will complete professional degree programs. 
*The photo was taken next to the gazebo in the town square where the four members are from. Ali is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy boots

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Verna is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Verna has a furniture making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, etc..

Verna has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Verna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo for her furniture making business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Delia has been in this business for 35 years. Delia earns more income from fish vending.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard, her husband, 73 year old mother-in-law and Alvard's two children live in Shirak region. This family's only occupation is in agribusiness. Alvard with the help of her husband, cultivates wheat and potato and also keeps livestock of four cows and four calves.  She uses the milk in production of cheese and other type of dairy products and her husband sells it in the market. 

Alvard asks this loan to invest in her farming business and develop it. She plans to use it in purchasing potato and wheat seeds and fertilizer to start land cultivation and earn income for the family. 

Because the region where Alvard's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Alvard's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato and wheat seeds and fertilizer to start land cultivation and earn income for the family

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and has seven children. Virginia is married and has four children who are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock, to save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji Village. Hauwa joined Babban Gona to improve the life of her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hauwa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hauwa now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to buy a maize grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials to construct a household toilet facility for his family and tenants

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ibrahim suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ibrahim has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase he yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Ibrahim can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a poly tank for his wife to start a water vending business in his community, also to help pay school fees

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsoro Village. Ali joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ali will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.  This season, Ali has grand plans to harvest 50 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ali now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and help get his children post secondary education

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en: Bulus is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsoro Village. Bulus joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bulus  will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Bulus now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and help him buy farming machinery

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merla is 52 years old now.

Merla has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Merla requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more kinds of banana to sell in the market.

Merla has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Merla would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of bananas to sell in the market so as to secure the future for her family

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Isah joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Isah suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Isah will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Isah now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Rahimatu

texts.en:
Rahimatu is 39 years old. She is married to a fisherman and has three children between the ages of ten and sixteen. With the support of her husband she owns a store where she sells sachet and bottled drinking water and some provisions at Bubiashie.

She want to expand the business by buying different varieties of sachet water to serve the need of all her clients. With this loan, she will be able to buy more bags of water and sell it. She believe this will help to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of sachet water and resell it to her customers which will expand her business

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bakin Kofa Village. Amadu  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Amadu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags; increasing his income considerably. This season, Amadu has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Amadu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old. He is married and has two children between the ages of eleven and fifteen years. He is a security man in Accra and is also a plastic waste collector. Joseph usually buys the plastic waste from his neighbors, then hires a tricycle and transports the plastic waste to recycling companies in Accra to sell it to them. The recycling companies recycle the plastic waste and sell it to sachet water producers that produce drinking water. 

Joseph will use this loan to buy more plastic waste and resell it. He believes that in five years time, he will be able to buy a tricycle in order to minimize the cost involved in transporting the plastic waste.

loans.use: To buy plastic waste from his neighbors and sell it to recycling companies to produce sachet water

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Hassan joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hassan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hassan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is 42 years old.   She is working as a driver and she is an artisan. Gisela hired a driver but he quit the job, so she is driving the vehicle  Lately, Gisela is been helping her mother at her business (she makes candy for Bolivian rituals for good luck).

Gisela needs a loan to pay for the repair of her vehicle.  

Gisela appreciates your help.  She would like to finish her secretary studies in the future.

loans.use: to pay the repair of her vehicle

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and she works as a secretary.  Ana is the mother of two children. Ana is divorced and she supports her family alone.

In her free time, she sells appliances. She offers the appliances to her neighbors, friends and office partners  Ana needs a loan to buy more appliances so she can earn more extra money.   

She hopes you can help her because she is healthy and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more appliances

loans.name: Fabio

texts.en:
Fabio is a farmer and he lives with his wife.  Fabio has 5 children, 3 of whom are going to school.  

He sells flowers and he also provides sand to construction companies.  He moves the sand using a very old truck that helps him to support his family.    

Fabio needs a loan to buy flower seeds. He hopes you can help him because he has great plans for the future. He would like to buy a tractor.  Fabio is healthy and responsible.  

In the picture Fabio appears with his wife

loans.use: to buy flower seeds

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 55 years old now. She is a divorced woman. She had two sons, but she lost one in an accident. 

Miriam is still selling peanuts and she needs a loan to buy more peanuts because she is ready to manage larger loads. She works every Monday to Sunday. 

She hopes you can help her because now she is living with one of her sons and she has to do all the work alone.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Saratu Delu

texts.en:
Saratu Delu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Rafin Tabo Village. Saratu Delu joined Babban Gona to expand her farm and grow her agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saratu Delu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

This season Saratu Delu has grand plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Saratu Delu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to diversify her farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. Rahila joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children.  In the past, Rahila suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Rahila has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Rahila can now ensure that her children go to school and get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is thirty nine years old. He is single and has a son who is nineteen year old. He is a craftsman and also a plastic waste collector. He has been collecting plastic waste for five years now. George has always dreamed of owning a tricycle one day to help him in his plastic waste collection business and has started saving towards that.

He will use this loan to add with the money he has saved and buy a tricycle to collect plastic waste. He believes that this will help him to collect more waste and increase his income

loans.use: To add to his capital and purchase a tricycle for plastic waste collection

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 20 years old and he lives alone.  He pays rent.  Henry is the owner of a minibus and he works every day. 

Henry needs a loan to fix and paint his vehicle. The vehicle also needs a new engine.  Henry hopes you can help him because he lost his parents long  time ago and he doesn't have any friends who can loan him some money.

Henry is healthy.

loans.use: to fix and paint his vehicle

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 52 years old and he pays rent.  He is divorced and he drives a car to earn some money and is working at night.

Ricardo needs a loan to buy a new engine for his vehicle although Ricardo is divorced he collaborates with his ex wife to support his daughter.

 He hopes you can help him again

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his car

loans.name: Jonald

texts.en:
Jonald is 35 years old and lives in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. He is married with two school-age children. He is a farmer who cultivates rice. 

To generate additional earnings, Jonald wants to start raising pigs. He has requested a loan to buy five piglets, feed, and build a concrete pen to start the business. 

He has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, he wants to raise healthy pigs to earn money for his family.

loans.use: to buy five piglets, feed, and build a concrete pen to start the business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for and harvesting, and is earning anincome, as well. Myrna has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Myrna has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and bags of chicken manure for her garden. Someday, Myrna hopes to purchase a parcel of agricultural land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and bags of chicken manure for her garden and one day to buy more land

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 59 years, is single and he doesn't have children.   He pays rent and drives a micro bus.  It is the only way Pedro makes money and he works from Sunday to Monday.  He starts his job at 6:00 a.m.until midnight. 

Pedro would like to have his own house in the future.  He needs a loan to buy tires for his mini bus.  He hopes you can help as he is desperate.  He doesn't know where to go.  He is alone and he doesn't have close relatives

loans.use: to buy tires for his minibus, which is his only income

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is from Dapitan, Philippines. She is a widow with four adult children. She is a farmer who wants to start hog raising business. 

Angelita has requested a loan to pay for three piglets, feed, and build a concrete pen to start her chosen business. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she wants to expand and improve her business to continuously provide for her needs, even help support her grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for three piglets, feed, and build a concrete pen to start her chosen business

loans.name: Tultuli

texts.en:
Tultuli is a married woman from Alipurduar. She is 36 years old and an active and energetic entrepreneur. Tultuli lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in a small village in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Two of her children are students of a local school. She is a woman of strong determination and perseverance, through which she has achieved success in her small milk selling business.

Tultuli's husband, 44-year-old Shiben, is engaged in a spice-selling business. His income is not adequate, so the family survives on Tultuli's small scale business of rearing cows and selling milk. Out of this income, Tultuli spends the lion's share in her family's household expenses compulsorily towards emergencies and her children's education expenses, and can save only a small amount. But the amount is not sufficient to face the growing inflation and to adequately cover the needs of the family.

So to improve their financial and living situation, Tultuli wants to increase the earning potential of her milk selling business. She seeks a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to buy a new cow, which will allow her to sell more milk and cow dung manure. The loan will help her to take the necessary steps towards ensuring that they can provide well enough for their children's education and better future. Later on she dreams of purchasing more cows. She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old and lives with her husband and her children.  Eva makes candy for Bolivian or Andean rituals used to bring good luck.  In Bolivia many people believe in those things, so Eva has a lot of work.  She makes the candy from 5:00 in the morning.  Now she is being assisted by her daughter.  She also distributes the candy to many small towns. 

Eva needs a loan to buy inputs to make more ceremonial incense candies. Eva uses a bus to go to the towns as you can see in the picture

loans.use: to buy inputs to make more ceremonial incense candies

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Leonida is separated and has three children now at their school age. Leonida as the sole bread winner earns income from a coconut and copra trading business for almost 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this business activity. 

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 13,000 to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and re-trading. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional coconuts for copra processing and re-trading

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 56 years old and he pays rent he is still working as a driver.  Edgar is divorced but he takes care of his 3 kids.  Edgar is living alone and he doesn't have too much time to see his kids, but he does his best to give them a good life.

Edgar needs a loan to buy new tires and a car battery. He hopes you can help him as you did before.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a car battery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es:
Jose tiene 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge en la parte rural del distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como son arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 20 años dedicándose al negocio y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old. He lives in a rustic material house of his own with his spouse in the rural part of the Colasay District in the province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain range of Peru. The people of this district work mainly in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry.             

He makes a living selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, among others. He has been devoted to the business for more than 20 years and has good personal and work references in his district. The purpose of the loan will be for the purchase of a greater amount of products to increase his business stock. With this, he hopes to satisfy his customers' needs, which will allow him to generate greater income and therefore be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount of products to increase his business stock.

loans.name: Yesid Stiven

texts.es: Yesid de 22 años de edad es residente de un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla, desde niño le gustó el comercio y en cuanto se le presentaba la oportunidad encontraba la manera de demostrar sus dotes como buen vendedor; en el colegio vendía yogures a sus compañeros.  Hoy en día tiene una venta de traperos, escobas, recogedores y alterno a esta actividad ofrece ropa y zapatos deportivos a sus vecinos y amigos, todos los días en el horario de  9 a.m. a  4:00 p.m., a quienes les ofrece comodidad de pago. En esta actividad lleva 9 años, con muchas metas y propósitos de expansión, para continuar cada día creciendo y siendo más reconocido. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir la compra de escobas, traperos, cepillos y pedidos de ropa; camisetas y zapatos deportivos.  Esta inversión permitirá responder a las solicitudes de clientes y con ello a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Yesid, age 22, lives in a neighborhood to the south of Barranquilla.  He has liked commerce ever since he was a boy.  When presented with the opportunity, he found the way to demonstrate his talents as a good salesman.  At school he sold yogurt to his colleagues.

Now he sells rags, brooms, and dustpans.  He also has a business selling clothes and athletic shoes to his neighbors and friends every day from 9:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  He offers them convenient payments.

He has been engaged in this business activity for nine years.  He has a lot of goals and plans for expansion in order to continue growing every day and becoming more well-known.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy brooms, rags, and brushes.  He will also use the loan for clothes orders, t-shirts and athletic shoes.

This investment will allow him to respond to his customers’ requests.  With this he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy brooms, rags, and brushes and for clothes orders, t-shirts and athletic shoes.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 51 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.

Maribeth is a duck raiser for about 23 years already and earning an approximate income of not less than approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional 100 ducklings for her existing duck raising business.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for three years already. In the future, Maribeth hopes to expand her duck raising by establishing her own poultry house and egg incubator units to produce her own ducklings for sale.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional 100 ducklings and to be able to buy an egg incubator

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children who are now adults. Alicia is engaged in the fishing and ice vending business for almost 30 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fishing gear and accessories, particularly zinc sinker, fishing nets, and marine boards as well as for boat repairs. Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 9 years already. 

In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her fishing vending business by means of acquiring additional fishing boats and fishing gears.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing fishing gear and accessories and in the future to aquire more fishing boats

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 30 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are at school.  Melody has the skills in hog raising and this business helped her and her family in meeting their needs. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month from this business, which she's been engaged in for about 3 years already. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional 2 heads of pigs for her business. Melody has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Melody hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To buy additional 2 heads of pigs and to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Isadora

texts.en:
MA.Isadora is thankful that she was granted a 11000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 15000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and cellular phone loads which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Isadora dreams of having a bigger general store and prays for a good and abundant life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 53 years old and married with eight children. With three children currently in school, Daylinda works very hard to provide for them.

Daylinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Daylinda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Daylinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 69 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, who are adults. Lucia has been engaged in hog fattening for more than 3 years and earns approximately PHP1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. The said amount as her income, helped her a lot in meeting their needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional piglet and a sack of feed for her existing hog fattening business. Lucia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

 In the future, Lucia hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing an additional piglet and a sack of feed

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie is 42 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are now at their school age. Perlie earns mainly from their (public utility vehicle) PUV-Van and motorcycle for hire business for the past four years. At present, she is serving as a Barangay Treasurer in her community. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 heads of calves as her new line of livelihood activity. Perlie has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Perlie hopes to purchase additional units of PUV-Vans for hire to add to their daily income.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing 2 heads of calves

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leticia is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Leticia has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Leticia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Leticia has been in this business for 9 years. Leticia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Liliana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Liliana es la menor de 2 hermanas y vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Lima. Ella escogió estudiar la carrera de Diseño Gráfico, porque le gusta mucho todo lo relacionado con artes gráficas. Actualmente se encuentra en el II Semestre de la carrera. Aún le falta por culminar 2 años y 2 meses. Ella estudia casi 60 horas a la semana, entre clases teóricas y prácticas, por lo que llega a casa muy cansada.

Al culminar su carrera siente que la beneficiará económicamente, porque se desempeñará en lo que siempre le ha gustado. Ella piensa trabajar en una importante empresa gráfica, o quizá poner su propio negocio, para así apoyar a su familia. 

Sus padres trabajan eventualmente, lo cual no les permite tener ingresos fijos y eso pone en peligro la continuidad de sus estudios. Su hermana también trabaja para poder apoyar a su familia, pero sus ingresos son mínimos y solo le permiten solventar sus necesidades.

Toda esta difícil situación por la que está atravesando, la llevaron a solicitar un crédito educativo para que pueda continuar con sus estudios. Es por eso que busca el apoyo de KIVA, para que le den la oportunidad de convertirse en una excelente diseñadora gráfica, como siempre lo ha soñado. Sueña con culminar exitosamente su carrera, seguir especializándose más, para desempeñarse de manera eficiente en una empresa importante.

Por último, Liliana les quiere expresar lo siguiente: "Me siento muy agradecida porque gracias al apoyo que ustedes me brindan puedo ser una profesional y cumplir mis sueños. Gracias KIVA por el apoyo y la oportunidad que me brindan".
texts.en:
Liliana is the younger of two sisters who live with their parents in the city of Lima.  She chose to study graphic design because she really likes everything having to do with graphic arts.  She is currently in the second semester of her studies.  She still has two years and two months to go in order to finish.  She studies almost 60 hours a week between theory classes and practicums.  Therefore, she is very tired when she gets home.

Upon finishing her degree, she feels she will benefit financially because she will be working at what she has always liked.  She plans to work for an important graphic company, or perhaps she will set up her own business in order to support her family in this way.

Her parents work occasionally, which does not allow them to have a fixed income.  This puts the continuation of her studies in jeopardy.  Her sister also works in order to be able to support her family.  However, her income is minimal and only allows them to pay for their necessities.

The difficult situation that she is experiencing is what brought her to request an educational loan in order to be able to continue with her education.  That is why she is seeking Kiva’s support so that they will give her the chance to become an excellent graphic designer as she has always dreamed of doing.  She dreams of successfully completing her degree and further specializing in order to work in an efficient way for an important company.

Lastly, Liliana wishes to express the following, “I am very grateful because, thanks to the support that you have given me, I will be able to be a professional and fulfill my dreams.  Thanks, Kiva, for the support and the opportunity you are giving me”.

loans.use: to make her graphic design payments to finish her studies and become an excellent designer.

loans.name: Taalaikan

texts.ru: Таалайкан, 42 года, замужем, 4 детей школьного возраста. У Таалайкан среднее образование, есть магазин, где Таалайкан продает товары широкого назначения. Однако основное ее дело - сельское хозяйство. Есть земельный надел размером 0,93 ГА, где Таалайкан выращивает ячмень. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец и 2 лошади. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Таалайкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от бизнеса Таалайкан планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития бизнеса и ремонта дома.
texts.en: Taalaikan is 42 years old, married, and she has four school-aged children.  She has a secondary education and runs her own store where she sells staple goods.  However, her main activity is agriculture.  She grows barley on 0.93 hectares of land.  She also owns four cows, 15 sheep and two horses.  She makes a monthly income of 19,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four steers for fattening and resale.  Taalaikan is planning to use the earnings from her activity to further grow her business and to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy four steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58-years-old and has three children. Josephine is married and has one child who is still in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Naciana

texts.en:
Naciana is 40-years-old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Naciana is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Naciana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Naciana has been raising cattle for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Naciana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna, gracias al esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia ha logrado salir adelante en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y golosinas. Está casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo es su principal apoyo. Para aumentar su inventario y mejorar las ganancias doña Reyna solicita un crédito para comprar bebidas gaseosas y golosinas entre otros, de esta manera lograra suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Dentro de sus metas esta mejorar su casa y darle un buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Reyna, thanks to the efforts and support of her family, has achieved some success in her small business from selling soft drinks and candy. She is married and has a son; her husband is their main support. To increase her inventory and improve profits, Reyna is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks and candy, among other items, so that she can meet the demand of her customers. Her goals include improving her home and providing a good future for her son.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and candy, among other items.

loans.name: Shobharani

texts.en:
Shobharani lives at the small village of Falakata in West Bengal. She is 46 years old, a hardworking mother of two sons. She is a homemaker. Her husband's occupation is farming, and he works hard to meet the family’s needs. Shobharani knows the value of education in life to overcome financial hurdles. So, she wants to provide better education to her children.

Shobharani's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Shobharani also helps her husband with the cultivation during busy seasons. The crops they grow are sold in the market, which is the main source of income for the family. By doing this, they generate income that is spent in buying household requirements and payment of other fees.

Now they want to grow teasel gourds, which are fully a summer crop. She wants to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the forthcoming summer season. So, she wants to buy farm supplies.

She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary agricultural inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

She is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a sink, fix pipes, and make a drain, in addition to other home repairs.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito que Elías  tiene con el Grupo “San José”.
