Elías nos comenta que gracias a su crédito anterior logro abonar su cultivo de siembra de piña y ahora está en pleno producción ya que obtendrá buenas ventas de piñas. Una de sus metas de Elías es tener una buena venta de sus piñas y así podrá ahorrar un pequeño capital para poder renovar su anterior negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en el cultivo de su sembrio de piña y así obtener  mayor cantidad producción. Elías es la persona que esta en el centro de la foto viste pantalón marrón
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por confiar en él.
texts.en:
This group is beginning its second loan cycle. The majority of the members know one another and are responsible. This is the second loan that Elías has had with the "San Jose" group. Elías  says that  thanks to the previous loan he managed to fertilize his pineapple crop, is now in full production, and will have good pineapple sales.

One of Elías's goals is to have a good pineapple sales, and be able to save a bit of working capital in order to renovate his previous business. Elías is the person in the center of the photo wearing brown pants. He is grateful to the Kiva investors for their trust in him.

loans.use: To maintain his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria is 54-years-old and married. Helaria works very hard to provide for her family.

Helaria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helaria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soy sauce, detergent soap, vinegar, cereals, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Helaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analita is 48 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Analita has a buy-and-sell mangoes business in the Philippines. Analita requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers.

Analita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Amina is an Indian rural housewife who always thought the best for her family. She resides in a small village called Parengerpar in Falakata with her husband and three sons. She is an illiterate (but can sign her name only) woman, but she wants to provide a good education to her sons. Two of them are studying in grades 8 and grade 4 respectively, and their elder son is working in a stationery shop.

Amina’s husband is a farmer by profession. He has been associated with cultivation for many years. So, he acquired lots of experience in farming. Amina also assists her husband in the field work. Earlier, they used to grow different types of vegetables and crops in different seasons. But now they thought of growing maize on their productive land.

Throughout the world, particularly in developing countries, the diet of populations is based on the consumption of a cereal grain, usually maize. These types of basic foods are full of nutrition and also have an international value. So, nowadays maize is very much in demand in markets.

So, they want to cultivate maize and sell it directly to the market shops, but because of lack of financial inputs, they cannot start this maize cultivation. For that reason, Amina applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, manure, pesticides, etc. to cultivate maize.

Amina wants to thank BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and other agricultural supplies to start maize cultivation.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Evelyn has a raising cattle business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle and save for her children to go to college

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Joan has a business direct-selling personal products in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products to sell, such as detergent soap, body spray, body soap, and lotion. Joan has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell, such as detergent soap, body spray, body soap, and lotion.

loans.name: Vima

texts.en:
Vima is 42 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vima has a general store business in the Philippines. Vima requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Vima has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Vima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store and to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 23 years old and married with two children. Melissa works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Melissa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melissa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen is single and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Kathleen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business, such as fabric, threads, and needles. Kathleen has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Kathleen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business, such as fabric, threads, and needles.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya is 55-years-old and she lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. She successfully ended her first Kiva loan that she used for her business development and she is greatly thankful for that support. This time she is also sure that her partnership will be pleasant and profitable. 

Amalya’s husband works abroad in the Russian Federation. Her daughters are married and they live with their families separately. Amalya still manages her business in a rented stall in the central part of the city and here she sells a great and nice assortment of cosmetics, stationary, men's and women's perfumes, self-hygiene supplies and different varieties of hairdryers. She finds her business great and she is sure that if she receives some support again she will develop it more. This loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, she will use to renew all the assortment of her stall, which she always arranges so cutely and attractively.

loans.use: to renew all the assortment of her stall, which she always arranges so cutely and attractively

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old, a resident of Kyotera town in Rakai district and married with three children all attending school. She carries out a business of a bar and guest house which she started in 2013 after she left her previous job and she had saved some money.

She works seven days a week and 17 hours per day and started this business with the aim of improving her daily income. Ruth wants a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more stock for her business since there is a demand for the products by her customers. Ruth’s clients are residents and people from the surrounding areas in the trading center. However her challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business and competition.

Ruth is a hardworking lady who always aims at having a bright future while looking after her children with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy stock of soda, wine and beer.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is a 47-year-old married woman of Chuakhola village in Falakata. She is raising two children (one daughter and one son). Suchitra has received education up to grade 4, while her husband completed up to grade 8. Amongst her children, one is studying in grade 9, and the other one is working in a mobile shop.

Being a homemaker, Suchitra runs her animal husbandry, and her husband Kajal is associated with painting work. As such, they work as hard as possible so their children do not face any problems in their daily lives, but due to inadequate earnings Suchitra is unable to fulfill her family’s daily basic needs.

So, she took a decision to take a loan to purchase one more cow to sell milk and cattle byproducts to her neighbors and local area people. Both the items are in great demand in her rural area, and she will attain profit from it. Moreover, she wants to help her husband in any condition.

Now they are living in a kachha house (house made of mud and straw). After having good profit from this business, she would like to build a pakka house (concrete house) for her family and would love to give financial support to both her children so that they can live happily throughout their lives.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan, as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her animal husbandry to sell milk.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Kalpana lives a small village called Sobhagunj of Alipurduar in West Bengal. She is a married woman with two sons. Both of them are students. She is an energetic, enterprising woman, but illiterate, and knows how to sign her name only.

Her husband Jibon works as a mason to earn money. Kalpana looks after her own animal husbandry. She has been successfully running her business of selling milk; also cattle byproducts for additional income. She sells those products to her neighbors and local rural villagers. Running this business not only supplements her family’s monthly income, but also provides her with a sense of doing something worthwhile. However, considering future requirements, their monthly income and savings are not sufficient.

Therefore, Kalpana seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy another cow with an expectation of more income as she expands her milk-selling business. She will be able to save for a secure future for her family with the profit generated from her milk-selling business.

She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Maria Diuvijilda

texts.es: María es una señora humilde que tiene 57 años de edad, María crecio en el campo, María tiene 3 hijos que son mayores de edad, María  vive con su esposo  y se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganaderia y comenta que de estas actividades es que saco adelante a sus hijos. María necesita el dinero del credito para comprar una vaca. María sigue trabajando y comenta que aunque es dificil su negocio ya que para el ordeño de sus vacas tiene que hacerlo en la madrugada. María tiene la aspiracion de comprar mas vacas y seguir trabajando hasta que lleguen a ser viejitos y tener una vejez digna.
texts.en: María is a humble woman who is 57 years old. María grew up in the countryside. She has 3 adult children. María lives with her husband and works farming and raising cattle. She comments that she raised her children through this work. María needs the money from a loan to buy a cow. María continues her work and comments even though her business is difficult as she has to milk the cows very early in the morning. María hopes to buy more cows and continue to work until she is old and enjoy a dignified old age.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 46-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vivian has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, such as pants, shorts, blouses, and rugs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vivian has been in this business for eight years. Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, such as pants, shorts, blouses, and rugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Katsalle Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Adamu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Adamu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and pensioner mother in Khulo district. Zurab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has four cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell locally. 

Zurab wants to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,600 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a minibus and will work on a minibus line to transport people to generate income. Zurab will have a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on a minibus line to transport people

loans.name: Prabhati

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Prabhati is a homemaker. Her family consists of three members: she and her husband with their only son. Both Prabhati and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only. They live in Dakshin Parengerpar village in Falakata of West Bengal. Though they could not have the opportunity to receive education, they want to provide quality education to their only son. He is in grade 11 now.

At present, Prabhati's husband deals with a cow dung manure business. Cow dung is used as farm manure by the cultivators in their village. He does not have any cows, so he purchases bulk cow dung from village cow owners and then stores the cow dung in a pit in the ground to avoid any damage or loss. Then he supplies this to his customers as per their demand. After managing the household work, Prabhati also assists her husband in this business.

According to Prabhati, in the context of the present market situation, the income from the business is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of the future development. Although there is a potential market for her husband's business, finance was a hindrance for them. So, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for the development of the business. She has planned to purchase more cow dung to generate more income to materialize her dream of a better lifestyle for her family.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cow dung in bulk for her farm manure business.

loans.name: Graciela Patricia

texts.es: Patricia es madre soltera, tiene 34 años de edad y su hijo tiene un año. Patricia vive con sus padres que le enseñaron a la actividad de crianza de animales menores. Patricia comenta que trabajaba de empleada domestica y comenta que desde que nacio su hijo tuvo que dejar de trabajar. Patricia solicita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos y seguir adelante con su negocio. Patricia tiene la aspiracion de seguir en su negocio y que le vaya bien para tener los recursos para alimentar y velar por el bienstar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia, 34, is a single mother and her son is one year old.  She lives with her parents who taught her how to raise young animals.  Patricia says that she used to work as a domestic and she says that, since her son was born, she has had to stop working.  
Patricia is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs and go ahead with her business.  She hopes to continue with her business and that all will go well so she has the resources to feed and watch out for the well-being of her little son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar from Gavar city, in the Gegharkunik region, hopes for Kiva support to develop her business. She works at the city wholesale market in a rented stall and she sells a great assortment of women's clothes, women's and men's underwear, children's clothes and shoes. She is a kind and pleasant saleswoman and her customers are always satisfied both with her polite and patient service and with her stall’s assortment. 

Tamar is married. She has a son who is married and lives abroad. Her husband helps her in her business very much, especially with the purchase of new merchandise for her stall, which they bring from Yerevan in a rented car. 

She will use this loan to buy new spring and summer clothes collections for her stall since seasonal clothes are in great demand now.

loans.use: to buy new spring and summer clothes collections for her stall

loans.name: Rebeca Estefanya

texts.es: Estefanya es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una casa humilde que se encuntra en el campo. Estefanya se dedica a cuidar pollos y con este negocio se ayuda para sus estudios ya que se matriculo a la universidad y espera seguir teniendo los recursos economicos necesarios para pagar sus estudios. Estefanya necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos que los va a tener en el campo cerca de su casa. Estefanya tiene la esperanza de seguir en su negocio y que mejore sus ingresos para seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Estefanya is a young women who is 20 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in a humble house in the country.  She makes a living raising chickens and this business helps her with her studies, since she has entered the university, and hopes to continue having the economic resources necessary to pay for her studies.
Estefanya needs the loan money to invest in the purchase of chickens which she will keep in the field near her house.  She hopes to continue with her business and increase her income so she can continue paying for her studies.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es un señor de carácter tranquilo y muy trabajador que vive en el campo y se dedica al jornal, a la crianza y comercializacion de animales menores. Antonio vive con su esposa, sus  2 hijas y un hijo, de las edades de 18, 20 y 23 años.  Una  de sus hijas esta estudiando. La esposa de Antonio le apoya en su negocio. Antonio necesita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros. Antonio comenta que su mas grande aspiracion  es la de seguir trabajando duro para seguir apoyando a su hija que esta estudiando y a su  familia para mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antoniio is a man of tranquil and hard-working character who lives in the country and makes a daily living in the raising and commerce of young animals.  He lives with his wife, his two daughters and a son, of the ages of 18, 20 and 23.  One of his daughters is studying.  HIs wife helps him with his business.  
Antonio needs the loan money to buy calves.  He says that his greatest aspiration is to continue working hard in order to continue supporting his daughter who is studying and his family in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 36 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Mylene has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, personal product care and other grocceries

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a Married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 45 years old and has three children still in school.

Alma has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional cloth, zippers, thread, needles and other materials for her business.

Alma has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, zippers, thread, needles and other materials for her business

loans.name: Arcelli

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arcelli works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Arcelli is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully her previous loan and now she has requested another loan for further build her business.

Arcelli has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business to pride a secure future for her family

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is very happy that she had a chance to have deals with Kiva and Nor Horizon already twice and she will be happier if she will manage to have third Kiva loan again for farm development. She lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. In her farm she has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Her farm products she sells locally; she sells milk, cheese, butter, meat and eggs. She also started potato production (she sells it to re-sellers) on her plot of land, which is both source of income and good product for family use.  

Larisa is married and she has a large and lovely family including her husband, mother-in-law, her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. So her work about her farm and efforts are great in order sustain her family’s all needs. She will be so thankful if Kiva lenders help her again with loan amount, which she will use for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel for land cultivation activities and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel for land cultivation activities and also animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Avelina is 47 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Avelina has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

Avelina has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell and also to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en:
Anushik from Kapan city ended her first Kiva loan and as she mentions she enjoyed her partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon. The deal was profitable for her trading business, which she runs started from 1998.  

Anushik rents a stall where she sells a nice and colorful assortment of fruits and vegetables such as pears, peaches, bananas, apples, watermelon, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, carrots, cabbages, greens, etc. Anushik likes her business and she organizes it very cleverly and cutely. She has a lot of customers who daily visit her stall as her stall’s products are fresh and not expensive. All the products she buys from the villagers that sell their farm goods wholesale at the city’s market. 

Anushik feels happy as through her business she manages to support financially her children’s families. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she wants to spend for the purchase of new assortment of fruits and vegetables for her stall.

loans.use: for the purchase of new assortment of fruits and vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit thanks for his first Kiva loan and Kiva great support for his young family and cute farm. He hopes so much that this time again with receiving this loan he will have some more profit of his farming. Davit lives in Kapan city of Syunik region with his wife, daughter and small son. His wife is busy with the care of their children so Davit alone earns on his family living working very hard and all day long. 

In his farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a horse and a pig. He sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and meat to his regular customers, who buy it right from his farm. This time his chance of Kiva partnership, he wants to use for the enlargement of his farm. With this loan he will buy two more heifers and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more heifers and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Wilman Bladimir

texts.es: Wilman es un joven muy alegre que se dedica 2 años a su negocio que es una vidrieria. Wilman tiene 28 años de edad,  el tiene un cuarto por el que paga arriendo donde funciona su negocio. Wilman por motivo de trabajo vive solo ya que sus padres viven muy alejado del lugar de su negocio. Wilman necesita el dinero del credito para comprar vidrio y hierro para elaborar vitrinas, puertas, ventanas y demas productos que ofrece o le hacen pedidos. Wilman tiene su aspiracion  de seguir trabajando y  continuar siendo un joven de bien.
texts.en: Wilman is a very happy young man who has worked for two years in his glass business. Wilman is 28 years old. He has a rented room where he has his business. Because of his work, Wilman lives alone since his parents live far away from his place of business. Wilman needs the loan money to buy glass and iron to make showcases, doors, windows and other products that he offers or gets orders for. Wilman wants to keep on working and be an honest young man.

loans.use: to buy glass.

loans.name: Mutethya Museo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Rose; She is married and a mother of three children. Rose joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from the training, especially on savings mobilization and financial management.

She operates a kiosk and is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs e.g. cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour etc so as to add stock.  This will enable her earn more income and therefore be able to meet her family's basic needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs like cooking fat, sugar etc so as to add stock to her kiosk for increased income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Francisco Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Mujeres Luchadoras de San Francisco” conformada por 05 socias responsables con ganas de progresar.Rossi de 46  años es separada con 05 hijos dos de ellos  dependientes. Ella  tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes y bebidas.Rossi se siente orgullosa porque gracias al préstamo podrá mejorar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de gaseosas, leches, azúcar y arroz. El deseo de Rossi es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales. El grupo “Mujeres Luchadoras de San Francisco” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rossi  es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo color rojo y pantalón anaranjado.
texts.en: This is the new group “Mujeres Luchadoras de San Francisco” formed by five responsible members, with desire to progress. Rossi is 46 years old, separated and with five children, two of whom are dependent. She has a small grocery store where she sells grocery items and beverages. Rossi feels proud, because thanks to the loan she will be able to improve her business and improve her quality of life. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and rice. Rossi's wish is that all her children become professional. The “Mujeres Luchadoras de San Francisco” group is grateful to those people who made the loan possible. Rossi is the third on the right side; she is wearing a red t-shirt and orange pants.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Eriquita

texts.en:
Eriquita is 51 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Eriquita works very hard to provide for them.

Eriquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

She successfully paid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Eriquita has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 46 years old, is married and has four children.

Fe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Fe has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sabitarani

texts.en:
Forty-four-year-old Sabitarani lives in a small mud house in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar, India. She is a widowed woman with one son. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years back. After the death of her husband, she, with the help of her son, has managed their agribusiness.

Sabitarani cultivates various types of crops and vegetables. She is motivated to give financial sustenance to her family. So, she and her son both work tirelessly for the attainment of their goal. The land she works on is fertile to cultivate vegetables and maize. Her income is being generated from the sale of crops like maize, potatoes, beans, and gourds. But now she wants to concentrate on maize cultivation because this is a very profitable crop. Her main challenge is a lack of sufficient money to carry out farming activities. She wants some financial assistance.

She chose Kiva’s partner BJS to fund her because they do offer good training to farmers before giving out the loans. Sabitarani will use this loan to purchase agricultural materials such as seeds, manure, pesticides, etc. for maize cultivation.

Sabitarani hopes this loan will give a boost to her business and income. This will improve her family's living standards. With the profit, she intends to build a concrete house in the future.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase high-yield maize seeds and other farm supplies for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 6 Group

texts.en:
Xuyen, 35, is a Thai man who is married and has two children, a boy 13 years old and a girl 15 years old. He lives with his parents, his wife and his children in a Thai traditional house. Because his parents are at an advanced age, the living of the family relies on the working of Xuyen and his wife. They work at various agriculture activities such as cultivating rice, growing cassava, raising pigs, buffalo, chickens and ducks to have a stable income to provide for the family. The dream of offering a more abundant better life for the children motivates them strongly to continuously expand production.

This is the fourth time he has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and he will use it to buy food for the pigs. He hopes that his investment will bring good earnings, so he could improve his family's income significantly. Currently, his children attend school fully and he dreams they will graduate from a good college, get a good job and have a brighter future. In the picture, Xuyen stands the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Flordeliza requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gaudiosa is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gaudiosa has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Gaudiosa requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Gaudiosa has been in this business for 29 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Hermita

texts.en:
Hermita is 57 years old and single with one child. Hermita works very hard to provide for them.

Hermita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products.

Hermita has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products

loans.name: Pani

texts.en:
Pani is a 29-year-old young woman entrepreneur who has a strong determination to contribute in her family and to educate enough her one toddler son. That spirit gives Pani a new inspiration to exist in a better manner in her daily life. Her family tried hard to survive in the fittest way, and her husband works in a grocery shop. So, there has always been a chance of uncertainty present in every day.

Pani wants to expand her dairy business by purchasing another cow. This gives her an opportunity to produce more milk and earn sufficient money, which may secure not only her future, but her family’s future as well.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS for expanding her existing business. With the loan amount, Pani will be able to increase the quantity of milk and produce different types of milk products, which may enhance her capacity for earning money.

Pani gives heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for considering her capability and courage.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending  business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sindy Johanna

texts.es: Sindy de 26 años de edad,  ayudaba a su suegra  en su negocio de jugos y fritos, aprendió todo el manejo e inició su propio negocio muy motivada, le propuso a su suegra comprarle el carro de jugos y empezó a funcionar.   Todos los días en el horario de 6:00 a 10:30 a.m. y 4:00 a 8:00 p.m. los residentes del barrio el Ferry y los conductores de buses de una empresa cercana al  negocio, ubicados en el municipio de Soledad,  pueden deleitarse con los jugos naturales y  las deliciosas empanadas, arepas de queso y huevo, elaboradas con productos 100% naturales a excelentes precios. Sus compras las realiza en graneros y cancela de contado para tener mejores utilidades, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en la compra de frutas al por mayor  y realizará reparaciones al carro y compra de accesorios en acero.  Esta carismática mujer es madre de dos hijas menores de edad a quienes desea continuar educando, para que a futuro puedan asistir a la universidad y sean unas profesiones, Sindy también desea continuar sus estudios de secretariado. Su meta de negocio es iniciar un restaurante y refresquería para lograr su sueño de comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Sindy, 26, used to help her mother-in-law with her juice and fried food business.  She learned the whole operation and began her own business with great motivation.  She proposed to her mother-in-law to buy her a juice cart and began to operate.  Every day from 8:00 to 10:30 a.m. and from 4:00 to 8:00 p.m., the residents of the Ferry neighborhood and the bus drivers from a company close to the business, which is located in the municipality of Soledad, can enjoy natural juices, delicious turnovers, and tortillas with cheese and egg made with 100% natural products at excellent prices.  She makes her purchases at barns and pays off her account in order to get better goods.
For this reason, currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing request she makes through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of fruits wholesale and she will make repairs to the cart and buy steel accessories.
This charismatic woman is the mother of two young daughters whom she wishes to continue educating so that in the future they may attend the university and become professionals.  Sindy also wishes to continue her secretarial studies.  The goal of her business is to start a restaurant and refreshment stand in order to realize her dream of buying her own house.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale and she will make repairs to the cart and buy steel accessories.

loans.name: Concerdia

texts.en:
Concerdia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Concerdia is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Concerdia has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Concerdia requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Concerdia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Concerdia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and married with four children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling  charcoal.

Victoria aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
This woman lives in Syunik village of Syunik region. Her name is Nune. She has musical education and for many years till today she works as a musician at the city’s musical college and she is a teacher of piano. 

Nune is a widow. Her single son is already married and he lives separately with his family. Nune now lives with her retired mother and together take care of their small farm. Nune has a nice vegetable and fruit garden, which gives her harvest of potato, greens, tomato, beans and cucumber and she also has sweet harvest of grapes, mulberry, apple and plum. 

Nune is mainly engaged in swine breeding and she has her regular customers for his farm’s pork. She mentions that together with her sweet mom she manages to live on her earnings and also somehow she help her son’s family. 

She will be greatly thankful if with this loan she manages to buy fodder for farm pigs as now it has a lack of fodder.

loans.use: to buy fodder for farm pigs as now there is a  lack of fodder

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliza is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Flordeliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Iline

texts.en:
Iline is 32 years old and single. Iline works very hard to provide for them.

Iline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries.

Iline has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Iline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk foods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and single. Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in general store.

Luz has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in general store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has an E-loading station business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a 13,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional load to sell.

Beatriz has been in this business for six years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional load to sell

loans.name: Patricia Veronica

texts.es: Veronica a sus 29 años de edad se dedica a la elaboracion de ropa, ya que comenta que asistio a un curso de costura y aprendio a  esta actividad. Veronica tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad que es su madre quien cuida al niño mientras Veronica trabaja. Veronica necesita el dinero del credito para comprar tela. Veronica tiene buena clientela ya que les trata bien y hace un prendas de calidad. La aspiracion que tiene Veronica es de seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Veronica, at 29 years of age, makes a living making clothes.  She attended a sewing course and learned this occupation.  Veronica has a 2-year-old son.  Her mother takes care of her child while Veronica works.  

Veronica needs the money from this loan to buy cloth.  Veronica has good customers since she treats them well and makes quality garments.  Veronica's aspiration is to continue working and provide for her son.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Omurbek

texts.ru: Омурбек, 59 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитали 2 детей. У Омурбека - высшее образование, он зоотехник. Супруга работает библиотекарем. Омурбек в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Омурбека, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 лошади, 6 коров, 50 овец. На 4,0 Га арендованной земли он выращивает пшеницу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Омурбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма. Доходы от кредита Омурбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку собственного земельного надела.
texts.en: Omurbek is 59 years old and married.  He and his wife have raised two children.  Omurbek has a college degree; he is a zootechnician.  His wife works as a librarian.  In order to provide an income for his family, Omurbek is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started 20 years ago when he bought his first livestock. Thanks to his very hard work, he now has four horses, six cows and 50 sheep on his farm.  He also grows wheat and clover for resale on four hectares of leased land.  He makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow his farming business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening.  Omurbek is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further increase his number of domestic animals.  He's also planning to save enough money to buy his own land.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products such as soups, basic grains, coffee, soft drinks, candy, shampoo, etc., all wholesale.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carmelita is 48 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Carmelita has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more eggs to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more trays of eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 40 years old and married with six children. With five children who are currently in school, Cerila works very hard to provide for them.

Cerila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Cerila has been in this business for four years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Melva Victoria

texts.es: Melva, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, reside en la comunidad de Tocoa, Colon, junto a dos de sus hijas. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio para obtener ingresos y sostener a la familia, inició vendiendo accesorios para damas, sandalias y comida y hace dos años ha puesto un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, vende camisas, blusas para damas y pantalones. Ha obtenido 4 prestamos anteriores para mantener activo su negocio, actualmente solicita otro a la institución por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar un fardo grande de ropa mixta para mantener variedad de ropa y aumentar las ventas. Ella Sueña en tener su propio local en el centro de la comunidad para aumentar las ventas y que su negocio sea familiar.
texts.en:
Melva, 45, is a single mother responsible for three children.  She lives in the community of Tocoa, Colon, along with two of her daughters.  She has always made a living in commerce in order to get income and support the family.  She started by selling accessories for women, sandals and food and two years ago she created a business of selling second hand clothing.  She has this business in her house.  She sells shirts, blouses for women, and pants.
She obtained four previous loans in order to maintain the variety of clothing and increase her sales.  She dreams of having her own shop in the center of the community in order to increase sales and that her business be a family one.

loans.use: to buy a large bale of mixed, second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 36 years old and has four children. Cheryl is married and has four children who are still in school.

Cheryl is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cheryl has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Cristita requested a 12,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Cristita has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chickens and improve her chicken coop.

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en: Vazgen is a farmer in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. He lives here with his wife and together they do farming. On the farm Vazgen has calves, a bull, a heifer and chickens. With his farming and all the hardships with it he is happy and thankful to God that he is still healthy and active enough that he does all the work easily and with pleasure.  Vazgen sells a small assortment of his farm products right from his house, such as milk, meat and eggs. Vazgen is asking for this loan as his farm cattle have a lack of fodder and he will buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 4 años también se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Erlinda is 63-years old.  She lives in her own home with her family.  For the last four years, Erlinda has run small store out of her home.  She has also earned her living as a seamstress for the last ten years.  With what she earns from her work, Erlinda is able to meet some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase soups, eggs, staple grains, beverages, sweets, sweet breads etc. so she can earn a better income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soups, eggs, staple grains, beverages, sweets, sweet breads etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda y también una venta de tortillas, tiene 20 años de tener sus dos negocios con el cual ha podido salir adelante y solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. todo por mayor para poder surtir su tienda y asi poder generar mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Paulina is 65-years old.  She lives in her own home with her family.  She has a small store and also sells tortillas.  She has run both businesses for twenty years, and they have enabled her to get ahead and meet whatever expenses arise.  Paulina is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as wholesale sweets, beverages, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, Jello, sugar etc, to stock up her store, generate a larger income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sweets, beverages, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, Jello, sugar etc.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 7 Group

texts.en:
Thanh is a 28-year-old Thai lady who is married and the mother of a three-year-old boy. She lives with her husband and her child in a small house and works in agriculture production for a living while her husband is a trader who sells bamboo sprouts. Thanh works very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry, including cultivating rice and raising musk ducks and chickens. She is illiterate and doesn't want her child to be like her, so she continuously increases production to be able to provide better for her son. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the musk ducks and chickens. She believes that with the financial and technical support of the Program, her investment will bring good earnings and she could cover better living conditions for her family.

Thanh dreams of a bright future and abundant life for her child. In the picture, she stands the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for musk ducks and chickens

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: This woman’s name is Seda and she lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She lives with her husband who works at the gas station and her son who is also employed. Seda is a farmer and on her farm she has cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. With the help of her son, Seda sells her farm products such as meat, milk, cheese, curds and eggs. Seda greatly wants to enlarge the number of her farm cattle, but still she has financial hardships. Now this loan she will use to purchase fodder for her farm cattle with the hope that with her next deal with Kiva lenders she will enlarge the number of her farm cattle also.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: María Alba

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, hace años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación  tienen tres hijos mayores  de edad que viven en su casa.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha tocado trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia, ella trabaja de enfermera en un hospital del Estado pero desde que falleció su marido ella junto a sus hijos le ha tocado seguir con la actividad que realizaba su marido que es la agricultura, ellos tienen cultivos de cebolla, pimiento, melón, verduras,  maíz entre otras cosas, sus hijos son los encargados de los trabajos y ella cuando puede también se dedica a los trabajos en el campo, así de esta forma ella logra sacar adelante a su familia y también sus hijos logran sus ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar abonos y varios insecticidas que necesitan los cultivos para obtener una buena cosecha. Lleva 5 años  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos  son rápidos. Sus sueños es seguir adelante y que a su familia no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the communal bank "Amigas Solidarias" (Supportive Friends) meets in Crucita Parish, Portoviejo Canton. The area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this sweet place. The area is visited by many national and foreign tourists. It's known by the name “Crucita la Bella” (Lovely Crucita).

This is where señora María lives. She is 45-years old. Her husband passed away a number of years ago. Doña María and her husband had three children, who are now grown and live at home.

Doña María is a very industrious woman who has had to work hard to get her family ahead. She is a nurse at a state hospital; however, since her husband died, she and her children have had to continue his line of work, which is agriculture. They grow onions, peppers, melons, vegetables, corn and other produce. Doña María's children take care of the agricultural labors, and when she can, she also helps in the fields. In this way, she is able to get her family ahead and her children also have a source of income.

This loan will be used to purchase compost and various insecticides that the crops need to produce a good harvest.

Doña María has been with her communal bank for five years. She likes it because the loans come quickly. Her dreams are to continue getting ahead and for her family to lack for nothing.

loans.use: to purchase compost and various insecticides.

loans.name: Joani

texts.en:
Joani is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joani is 35 years old and has two children currently in school.

Joani has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joani requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Joani has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en: Baghdasar is a farmer who lives with his family in the village of Varser in the Gegharkunik region. He worked in different places but simultaneously he never gave up farming and agricultural work on his farm. Now he manages all the work around it already with his son. On his farm he has cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. Baghdasar lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. His wife and daughter-in-law greatly organize the sale of his farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curds, meat and eggs. Baghdasar has a large plot of land where the cultivation is very profitable since the harvest of potatoes that they gather from their land is perfectly and quickly sold. Now Baghdasar is asking for this loan as he wants to buy potato seedlings for his further agricultural activities and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings for his further agricultural activities and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Jenave

texts.en: Jenave is 40 years old and married with one child, who is still in school. Jenave is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Jenave has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to pay for spare parts, gasoline, and maintenance. Jenave would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, gasoline, and maintenance for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Hiran

texts.en:
Hiran is a married woman of 44 years. She is from Changpara village in Alipurduar. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She lives with her husband and one son in a small house. Her husband is a farmer, and her son works in a small shop because he could not receive education due to their poverty. Her husband, Tattu, is a rickshaw puller, and she works on farmlands as a labourer. 

Hiran has a plot of agricultural land on lease where she wants to grow paddy [rice]. Hiran is experienced in cultivation activities, especially for the time of harvesting. She wants to start paddy cultivation on her farmland for additional income. Paddy is one of the highest demand crops throughout the year, and so she has taken economic support from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS), Kiva’s partner, to buy agricultural supplies such as good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc. 

Hiran is a tenacious woman, who is ready to give her best effort for the betterment of her family. Her long-term goal is to get ahead with paddy cultivation, as it is profitable being the staple food for the people of her region. In future, she dreams of harvesting paddy in large quantity.

Hiran thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to start paddy cultivation on her farmland.

loans.name: Josefina América

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Josefina, tiene 49 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Josefina realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en sus actividades, el tiene cultivos de maíz y arroz, en esta época de invierno es cuando más hectáreas siembra razón  por lo cual necesitan del crédito, este crédito lo necesitan para comprar abonos y insecticidas  pues las  plagas están dañando los cultivos y necesitan los insecticidas para poder contrarrestar esta plaga y así tener una buena cosecha, el trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa que también en ocasiones le ayuda con sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Amigas Solidarias" (Supportive Friends) communal bank meet in Crucita Parish, Portoviejo Canton.  The area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this pretty area, which is visited by many national and foreign tourists.  It is known as “Crucita la Bella” (Lovely Crucita).
This is where señora Josefina lives.  She is 49-years old and married.  She and her husband had four children, who are now grown.  Two of their children still live at home.  Doña Josefina's husband is a farmer.  
Doña Josefina is taking out the loan for her husband to use for his business.  He has corn and rice crops.  This is the winter season, which is when he plants more hectares, which, in turn, is the reason for the loan.  They need it to purchase compost and insecticides.  The infestations are harming their crops.  They need insecticides to combat the infestations so they can have a good harvest.  Doña Josefina's children help with the farm work, and she does as well at times.  
This loan is for the purchase of insecticides and fertilizers.  
Doña Josefina has been with her communal bank for five years.  She likes it because of the help she gets from the loans.  Her hopes are for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 26,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 55 years old and married with one child. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery stock to sell. Julita has been in this business for 21 years.

She successfully repaid a previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet is 40 years old and with his wife and parents he lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Before, Hamlet used to go to the Russian Federation to work abroad, but after his marriage he gave up working abroad and seriously became engaged in farming. On his farm he has a not small assortment of cattle, such as cows, calves, bulls, a horse, sheep, lambs and chickens. Hamlet also has a hayfield and he manages to gather hay from it as fodder for his cattle. His farm products (milk, cheese, meat and eggs) he sells at the wholesale market. Hamlet has great plans connected to enlarging his farm cattle herd. In order to realize it little by little he is asking for this loan in order to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Larena

texts.en:
Larena, 57, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Larena has a fruit selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita, 39, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Leonita has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, flour, cooking oil, fish chicken, and utensils for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 51 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and other personal care products.

Lourdes has been in this business for 4 years.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en:
This couple is Teuta and her husband Petrit. They are both in their late 40’s and reside in a mountain village with beautiful God-created scenery (fresh air, a river in the middle of the village, lots of wild trees and wild animals as well). There used to be some coal mining long ago under the communist era that at the moment is out of function.

The couple are parents to two boys, 21 and 18 years old and Teuta is the village nurse, whereas Petrit works for a construction company. The house they live in is not theirs but they do not pay rent for it. It is out of shape though. When I, the writer, visited them with the loan officer, I was shocked to see how they lived in it. Too tiny, no amenities, and no kitchen and no washroom either and it seemed that it could collapse anytime. To make this house a bit liveable, they wanted this loan to repair the roof and buy a horse that will come in handy for them for the transportation of things.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of their poorly built and very old house which is about to collapse soon and buy a horse to help them out with village work.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lydia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lydia is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more personal care products to sell.

Lydia successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve au deuxième rang sur la photo, elle tiens le drapeau de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de M'Piebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 43 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 10 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Minata, âgée de 43 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 10 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille a incité Minata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Minata cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Minata entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Minata cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage des moutons . Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata is pictured in the back row of the photo holding the myAgro flag in her hands. She belongs to a group of eight farmers who are registered with myAgro. They all live in and work in the village of M'Piebougou, which is located to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. 

Minata is 43 years old and the mother of four children between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. Four of them go to school. 

She has been farming for over 30 years because this activity allows her family to be self-sufficient.

On her land, Minata plants peanuts and rice and also does market gardening. As a farmer, she deals with difficulties like a lack of farming equipment. 

This is Minata’s second loan with myAgro. She re-registered with them in order to increase her yield through the organization’s services. Their agents spoke with conviction about the advantages of the myAgro method. This year, Minata is buying a pack of myAgro fertilizer that she’ll use to increase her yield of peanuts on her 0.125-hectare parcel of land. 

Minata has been growing peanuts for 10 years because they are profitable. With the growth of her yield and revenue, she would like to raise sheep. In closing, Minata hopes to cover her children's schooling and ensure the dietary self-sufficiency of her family.

loans.use: buy a pack of fertilizer to increase the yield of peanuts on her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a bundle of mixed used clothing

loans.name: Albert Kervin

texts.es:
Albert es un joven que vive con su madre y 2 hermanos mayores. Su padre no vive en casa y no aporta, porque los abandonó desde muy pequeño. Su madre trabaja cuidando a una niña, el ingreso entre su hermano y uno de sus hermanos es mínimo.

Él está cursando el II Semestre de Redes y Comunicación de Datos, la cual le apasiona muchísimo por estar relacionada con la reparación y tecnología, que avanza día a día. Él tiene pensado especializarse en Administración de Redes. Le interesa mucho su profesión porque ve el avance de la tecnología y su meta más grande es ser un excelente profesional. 

Albert siente que su profesión lo beneficiará tanto económicamente como a ser mejor persona cada día, y le permitirá apoyar a su familia en cubrir los gastos necesarios de su hogar. 

Debido a la difícil situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia, él se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar el apoyo a KIVA, para poder continuar estudiando. De no tener el acceso al crédito, lo más probable es que Albert hubiera dejado de estudiar hasta estabilizar la economía en casa. Es decir, tendría que truncar sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional para buscar un trabajo.

Albert les quiere decir a los inversionistas de KIVA: "Este programa es de gran apoyo para los estudiantes moral y económicamente para que ellos puedan surgir en la vida y cumplan su sueño de ser profesional, apoyando de esta manera a su familia y a la sociedad. Muchas gracias KIVA por el aporte que brindan a todos los que más necesitamos."
texts.en:
Albert is taking second semester courses in Network and Data Communication and loves what he is doing as it is related to computer repair and technology, a field that is always advancing. He is thinking of specializing in Network Administration. His profession interests him greatly; his goal is to be a professional with an excellent job.

He feels that his work will benefit him both professionally and personally, allowing him to become a better person with every passing day. He will be able to help his family by paying for necessary household expenses. Because of the difficult economic situation that his family is experiencing, he has found it necessary to seek help from Kiva so he can continue his education. Without a loan it is very probable that Albert would have to quit his studies in order to help his family financially. In other words, he would have to forget about his dream of becoming a professional in order to look for work.

He wishes to tell Kiva lenders that the program is a wonderful financial boost to students as it allows them to make progress and complete their training so they can help their families. He wishes to thank Kiva for the support it brings to those who need it the most.

loans.use: pay for his Network and Data Communication studies

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is a 34-year-old housewife of a small village of Falakata. She lives there with her husband, Bablu, and three children (two sons and one daughter). They send their children to school, and they are studying in different grades. One of them has appeared in the secondary board examination (M.P). Laili is very ambitious, and wants to give a good education to their children.

They have their own land where her husband cultivates different vegetables and crops in different seasons, and supplies those items to the local market. Laili helps her husband in the agricultural work. Now she plans to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in paddy cultivation by buying necessary supplies like paddy seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc. Enterprising and knowledgeable, Laili decided to plant paddies because paddies are a year-round crop and a very popular crop. She knows she can earn more profit through it. 

Her future plan is to improve her financial condition and to extend her business. Her dream is to purchase a tractor in the future for more agricultural work.

She shows her gratitude to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers and urea for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

Edelyn has been in this business for three years. Edelyn earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Marijan

texts.en:
Marijan is an energetic woman of 46 years. She lives in the village of Baganbari in the district of Alipurduar in West Bengal. The village is one of the most remote in the region and lacks basic amenities such as pakka houses (made of concrete and mortar), electricity, etc. But the village is rich in spirit and the ideas of its women who want to be someone in life.  

Marijan is the mother of two sons. One is a student of class 12 and the other is engaged in cultivation with his father. Marijan's husband, Tafajjal, aged 55 years, is engaged in jute cultivation. This village has good agricultural land and access to ponds and rivers, making cultivation possible. They give their hard toil to grow good-quality products to satisfy their customers, and at the same time, earn for the family. They want to grow their agribusiness, but the main obstacle is capital.

Marijan has come to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them. She will invest this new loan in buying high-yield jute seeds, fertilizers and manure. She also wishes to increase her total cultivatable area. She hopes through the profit generated from their business, she will be able to give a better living to her family, provide better education to her child and at the same time, save money for the future to construct a concrete and mortar-made house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
