loans.use: to buy more crates of beers, sodas and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Melva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Melva tiene más de 24 años de  haber  iniciado una pulpería en su casa, y gracias a los  financiamientos de MiCrédito ha  podido  reabastecerla con la compra de materia prima, además de apoyarse con la compra de ropa pues también aprovecha su pulpería para venderla. Ella se siente agradecida pues con estos créditos  incrementó su capital de producción y gozo de muchas ganancias, convirtiendo su negocio en próspero y rentable. 

Por ello, solicita un nuevo financiamiento para comprar arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, queso, aceite,  golosinas y ropa. Esto le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá aprovechar para vender productos de temporada e incrementar así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
More than 24 years ago, Melva started a grocery store in her house, and thanks to the loans from MiCrédito she was able to stock it with new products. In addition, the loan helped her to buy clothing which she also sells in her store.

She is grateful because the loans increased her working capital and she could make her business successful and profitable and enjoyed a good income. For this reason she is asking for a new loan to buy rice, beans, soft drinks, cheese, oil, candy, and clothing. This will  help her a lot, because she will be able to use it to offer seasonal products and by this increase her income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soft drinks, cheese, oil, candy, and clothing.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a young mother of four children. She is 35 years old and lives in DairAlla. Her husband is working with a low salary. 

Alia did not complete her education because of the financial situation of her family, so she is working hard to provide a good education to her children. She sees herself in her children, and she wants to see them as successful people in the future.

A dream made Alia start thinking of how to be a productive woman and help her husband with their expenses. She started to sell a small quantity of clothes and cosmetics in her home. When she noticed that she is getting a good income from this, she decided to expand her work. Therefore, she asked for a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a caring father of two children. He is 32 years old and lives in Irbid. 

What inspired him to follow a course in math are his children, since they were asking him to teach them math. He could not do that because he did not complete his education due to the financial situation of his family.

Because of the financial crises that he has faced, he is requesting this loan to be able to cover the fees at his university and continue with his studies to achieve his dreams and to be a good hero to his children.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: JONNY: Es un señor amable de 33 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Waspam. Casado con 2 hijos: El mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 3 años de edad. Trabaja como vigilante en una de las universidades del municipio. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como divisiones internas que serán utilizados como cuartos.  Es por eso que solicita su primer préstamo para poder hacer estas mejoras. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jonny is a friendly, 33 year old man of mismita ethnicity in the Waspam municipality.  He is married with two children:  The oldest is 6 and is in first grade of primary school and the younger is 3 years old.  He works as a guard at one of the universities in the municipality.  

Little by little he has begun the construction of his wood home, however with his salary he didn't have enough to make internal walls that would serve as rooms.  For this reason he is requesting his first loan for these improvements.  With the loan he will buy wood, nails, and cost of labor.  He dreams of having a better house with more security and a good environment for his family.

loans.use: to build walls for his stilt and wood home.

loans.name: Thasee Group

texts.en: Maitee understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Maitee knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Maitee purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Maitee is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small fish and expand fish farming.

loans.name: Dongkhammuentai Group

texts.en:
Vanna is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Vanna and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Vanna and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Vanna and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Vanna and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. Also pictured is one of the borrower's children.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Cosméticos, ropa, perfumes, entre otros productos rodean la sala de Rosa, una comerciante de 24 años de edad que salió adelante con sus estudios, su hijo y su pareja. Anteriormente esta joven trabajadora había solicita un préstamo para pagar todos los gastos de graduación, ahora es toda una licenciada en Contaduría, razón suficiente porque quiere agradecer a todas las personas que la apoyaron a cumplir con este sueño. 
Actualmente Rosa sigue adelante como comerciante de ropa y cosméticos, tantos nuevos como de segunda mano, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercancía. Ella desea comprar camisas, vestidos, lápiz labiales, perfumen, pantalones, entre otros productos que le permitirán incrementar sus ingresos gracias a la alta demanda. Afortunadamente esta joven cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, pues juntos planean darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
There are a lot of cosmetics, clothes, perfumes, and other products in Rosa's living room. Rosa is a 24-year-old trader who got ahead with her education and who has a son and a partner.

The young, hard-working woman has asked for a loan before in order to pay for her graduation expenses. She now holds a full degree in Accounting, and for this reason she wants to thank everyone who helped her to fulfill this dream.

Currently Rosa works as a clothes and cosmetics dealer. She sells both new and second hand products. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise. She wants to buy shirts, dresses, lip pencils, perfume, trousers, and other products which will allow her to increase her income thanks to the high demand.

Fortunately, this young woman has the support of her husband, because together they plan to provide the best for their child.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, lip pencils, perfumes, trousers, and other products.

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en:
Thuraya is 39 years old, lives in Amman and is a married woman,mother of four kids, She is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Her husband is working with a low income and he has small cosmetics and clothes shop.  Thuraya thought to help her husband in his shop and decided to work with him, thus her husband will save a salary.
 
Now they want to expand the shop, because of the high standards of living.  Thuraya has asked for a loan to help her husband to buy new products to sell and they want to increase their incomes to improve the standard of living for their children.

loans.use: buy new products to sell and to increase her income to improve the standards of living for their children.

loans.name: Koudxoung Group

texts.en:
Thongsa is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Thongsa and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Thongsa and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  

Thongsa and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thongsa and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. Also pictured are some of the borrower's children.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help her buy new products to sell and to buy a household supplies to start commerce in new field

loans.name: Novemira

texts.en:
Novemira is 38 years old and married. She is from Moalbal, Cebu. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which she has been doing for two years. She sells biscuits, powdered soap, seasonings, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, etc. 

Novemira requested a loan, which she will use to purchase assorted groceries and beverages to keep her store fully stocked. Her income will slowly increase and she will be able to pay her obligations. Novemira hopes to expand her existing business so it becomes productive.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries and beverages

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is 43 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child now at school age. 

Charlene is engaged in retailing business particularly in a sari-sari store business for more than 15 years already. She is also engaged in a coconut and copra trading business. At present, she is serving in the Barangay as a day care worker. She earns approximately PHP3,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts to be processed for copra for resale. 
Charlene has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Charlene hopes to expand her coconut and copra trading business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional coconuts to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 5 children who are now adults.
 
Douglas is a retired member of the Armed Forces of the Philippines-Philippine Army (AFP-PA) and presently enjoying his monthly pension of not less than Php5,000 and been receiving this for 5 years already.  He is also receiving allowance from his daughter. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for their house repairs and renovations. Douglas has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Douglas hopes to engage in agri-business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Kiyagara Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Joseline is a 37 year old hardworking, married woman with 3 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She sells second hand clothes, alongside farming to earn additional income. With this, she has been able to generate income to cater for her family. She intends to expand her business but competition is a big challenge to her.

Joseline is requesting for a loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell to her customers

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: Josefina esta pasando por sus 50 años de edad, Josefina esta casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 2 estan estudiando, y los demas ya trabajan al jornal. El esposo de Josefina se dedica al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Josefina desde que era niña se dedica a la crianza de animales ya que crecio en el campo y aprendio de esta actividad. Josefina solicita el credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos. Josefina sigue trabajando y tiene la esperanza de incrementar su negocio y seguir trabajando readecuar los corrales para mejorar sus ingresos y tratar de  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: 50-year-old Josefina is married and is the mother of seven. Two of her children are studying and the rest are daily paid workers. Josefina's husband works on a daily basis as a farm labourer. Josefina has bred animals since she was a child as she was brought up in the country where she learned her trade. Josefina is applying for a loan to buy chickens. She continues working and hopes to expand her business and remain in business so she can mend her chicken run, which will enable her to boost her income and try to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 57 years old and married with seven children, She live in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Nellie sewing and dying cloth materials and sells it in her community to earn living. She has been doing this for two years.

She needs a loan to buy raw cloth materials, tools and a hand sewing machine to operate her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and also providing a better standard of living for her family. 

Nellie joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy fabric materials, dye color and a hand sewing machine for her clothing business.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Ms. Gantsetseg, 40 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's clothes at a trade center for seven years. Her husband makes and sells wood crafts after employment at construction company which stopped its operation. Their daughters both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2500 USD to buy children's clothes from China at low price. She will sell these clothes and make a profit during Children's Day Festival which is celebrated on June 1st of every year. The borrower is hardworking woman who mainly supports her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to help support her family

loans.name: Marlon David

texts.es:
Marlon es un joven de 24 años de edad, que se caracteriza por su emprendedurismo, lo cual le ayudó a lograr estudiar hasta 3er año de secundaria. Tiene un hijo con 1 año de edad, y junto a su esposa se dedican a las actividades de su finca donde cuentan con 2.8 hectáreas de café.

En los últimos 3 años él ha logrado mejorar los rendimientos de su café en un 125%,  dada la implementación de buenas prácticas que ha venido desarrollando. Para este ciclo, está solicitando un financiamiento para adquirir los agroinsumos que le permitan proveer a sus cafetos una nutrición adecuada para lograr una mejor productividad.

El sueño de Marlon es tener una finca con una productividad de 200 quintales de café pergamino de primera calidad y darle a su familia condiciones económicas.
texts.en: 24-year-old Marlon is a very determined young man and this quality enabled him to study until the third year of secondary school. he has a one-year-old child and he and his wife farm a 2.8 hectare coffee plantation. Over the last 3 years, Marlon has managed to improve his coffee production by 125% by using new techniques. This cycle, he is applying for funding to buy the agricultural supplies he needs to properly nourish his coffee crop and, thereby, boost his productivity. Marlon's dream is to have a farm which produces 200 quintals of top quality parchment coffee and to ensure that his family is financially stable.

loans.use: to buy supplies to help him have a good harvest on his coffee plantation

loans.name: Zalifa

texts.en:
Zalifa is 36 year old hardworking female. She runs a restaurant and started the business so as to cater for her family. She dreams to educate her children, however she is challenged by inadequate capital. 

She needs a loan to buy chairs,fridge,and food stuff to use in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy chairs,fridge and food stuff for her restaurant

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a dealer of Avon products such as lotion, body spray, beauty soap, accessories and many others. In addition to that, she also engages in soft drinks vending business. She sells  Coke, Aprite and Miranda. She is 45 year old, a married woman with 2 children ages 20 and 22 years old respectively. She lives in Moalboal, Cebu

She is asking for a loan to buy beverages and Avon products, like cologne, soap, fashion accessories and may others. These  would help boost Praxedes income and able to handle her finances. Thus, her income will improve and she could now set aside some savings for emergency use.

She hopes that, she could successfully manage her business for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy beverages and Avon products to set aside some savings for emergency use

loans.name: Magdalena Del Pilar

texts.es: A sus 43 años de Magdalena se dedica  a la crianza de animales y a trabajar al jornal de trabajos del campo, Magdalena esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 16,18 y 23 años de edad, el hijo de 16 años asiste al colegio. El esposo de Magdalena se dedica a trabajar al jornal. Magdalena necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Magdalena espera que le siga yendo bien en su negocio ya que con las ganancias que le deja su negocio  es como saca adelnate a sus hijos y este es su fuente de ingresos de toda su vida.
texts.en: 43-year-old Magdalena breeds livestock and works as a daily farm labourer. She is married and has three children aged 16, 18 and 23, the youngest one of whom is still at school. Magdalena's husband is a daily worker. Magdalena needs the loan to buy pigs. She hopes that her business will remain successful as it is her earnings which allow her to support her children and because this is her lifelong source of income.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish and increase fish yield in order to cover the family living expences

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Parengerpar is a small village in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. This village is surrounded by hills and forest. That helps Karima because she prepares plywood raw materials from the tender wood of the forest and sells them to the plywood manufacturing mills to earn a livelihood. Karima is an inhabitant of this village. She is 40 years old and resides with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is engaged in their family-run plywood raw materials supply business.

The main source of income for Karima's family is the business of supplying the raw materials for plywood manufacturing. Her husband purchases wood and cuts it into thin sheets and supplies it to the plywood manufacturing mills. All this is done by him with the help of Karima and their only son. They have been doing this business for many years. 

In spite of regular earnings, she is not able to improve her source of revenue. She wants to overcome this situation by expanding the business, and that is why she needs capital. Karima has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS to purchase more wood and other necessary materials for this business. 

She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of constructing a concrete house and giving a better life to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for expanding her plywood raw materials business.

loans.name: Lakhi

texts.en:
Lakhi is a married woman who is 25 years old. She lives in a remote village called Baganbari in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Her family consists of two members (her husband and their one toddler son). She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to getting her family ahead. Her husband is engaged with grill manufacturing work.

Lakhi rears cows and has supplied milk in her village for many years to earn additional income for her family. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased two calves. Gradually, she expanded her business, and now, her customers are also gradually increasing. 

In order to earn more Lakhi wants to purchase one more cow to serve more customers; that's why Lakhi is asking for a business loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. With the help of the generated profit, she will be able to raise the living standards of her family.

Lakhi is very happy and conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Sumati Rani

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Sumati is a rural housewife. She is from Raychenga village in Falakata. She lives there with her 50-year-old husband, Sajal, and two sons. Sumati and her husband are illiterate but can sign their names. Both of her sons could not receive education due to their poverty, so one of them runs a grocery shop and another is a mason by profession.

Her husband is a farmer and she, being a hardworking lady, helps her husband financially by running a grocery shop, after managing her household work. She sells food items like spices, rice, pulses, sugar, salt, oil, bread, eggs, biscuits, etc., and daily essential commodities. Now she wants to grow her business to satisfy the demand of her customers. Thus Sumati is taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop.

With the expansion of her grocery business, she hopes to have a better income which will help her to develop the financial status of her family. She wants to save the outcome profit for her children’s future and dreams to renovate her grocery shop with a variety of items.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: G.s Montes Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
El g.s. MONTES DE LOS OLIVOS esta conformado por tres integrantes, un hombre y dos mujeres, madres y padres de familias con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de la paz centro, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, 
gracias  a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Tomasa y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía en un lugar especifico de la localidad, tiene cinco años que se dedica a dicha actividad, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en artesanía para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. montes de los olivos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente para tener un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Montes De Los Olivos group is comprised of three members, one man and two women.  They are parents who have seven children for whom they are responsible.  They are from La Paz Centro, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  The group is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement.  In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children.

Tomasa is the coordinator, and thanks to her desire to get ahead, she sells handicrafts at a fixed place in the area.  She has been engaged in this business activity for five years.

The objective of the loan is to invest in handicrafts so that she is able to get better earnings in the near future.

Montes De Los Olivos is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries so that they can have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts like vases, flower pots, ashtrays, typical clothing, and hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Apu Marcasunay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU MARCASUNAY”; Este banco se encuentra  ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gabina, la socia sigue dedicandose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes entre otros.
Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale adjunta en la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: These are members of the “APU MARCASUNAY” communal bank; it is located in the Lamay district of Calca province which is in the department of Cusco. The featured member is Gabina, who breeds small animals such as guinea pigs. She breeds her small animals and then sells them to customers who ask for them. She is a responsible and hardworking person and this enables her to support her family. She is seeking a loan to buy guinea pigs among other things. The members are grateful to those who are helping them to achieve their dreams and guarantees that she will repay the loan within the set time. The member who is pictured separately sought permission to arrive late at the meeting on account of work commitments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among other things.

loans.name: 030403010002.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyến has a retail business selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable and resell.

Tuyến is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 030403010002.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tuyến has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Tuyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyến hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable to resell in order to support her family properly

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en:
Dexie is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children now at their adult age. For her means of living, she is engaged in hog raising business for 15 years already. She is also receiving support from her husband who is a carpenter. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used as allowance for her son's application for employment who is newly graduated in BS HRM course. Dexie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Dexie hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To be used as allowance for her son's application for employment

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 44 years old and single.

Clemencia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Clemencia requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Clemencia has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Clemencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs and to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to furnish a salon and to purchase hair dressing chairs to restore the family to financial stability

loans.name: Houyxay Group

texts.en:
Sounthone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Sounthone and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Sounthone and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Sounthone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jairo Adriano

texts.es: Jairo es un joven muy trabajador, el tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su abuelita con quien trabaja en su negocio que es el de comercializacion de visuteria, productos de primera necesidad, cremas para la piel, cosmeticos y demas productos. Jairo solicita el dinero del credito para comprar mercaderia en visuteria para mejorar su negocio que es familiar. Jairo tiene su aspiracion de seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su hijo que tiene 5 años y asiste a la escuela.Jairo tambien espera a futuro poder comprar un carro para facilitar la movilizacion con la mercaderia.
texts.en:
Jairo is a hardworking young man. He is 28 years old and lives with his grandmother. Together they work in their business, which is selling costume jewelry, staples, skin creams, cosmetics, and other products. 

Jairo is asking for a loan to buy jewelry to improve his business, which is a family business. His plan is to continue working for the welfare of his son, who is 5 years old and goes to school. Jairo also hopes to be able to buy a car in the future, to make it easier to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Working three part-time jobs sounds tough, right? But can you imagine working three part time jobs and experiencing one setback after another all while trying to raise a family? Frances has been working hard since day one, but continually struggled to become debt free and improve her credit score. Fortunately, Frances and her daughter, a single mother of two, have each other to depend on for support through difficult times.

Frances and her daughter are making progress, but the family is in dire need of a new central air conditioning system. Their home is currently being cooled by a very old window air conditioner, and the unit is approximately 20 years old. With the old unit no longer efficiently cooling the family's home, Frances is looking to install a central air conditioning system to improve the livability of her home during Florida's hot summer.

Frances has made great effort to live up to all of her financial obligations. Frances serves as an example to her grandchildren and everyone around her, that even when things don't go well, there is no excuse to stop striving for excellence.

Please help Frances finance a new high efficiency conditioning unit so she can continue her road to success and provide an improved quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a high efficiency A/C unit so she can continue her road to success and provide a happy and healthy home for her family.

loans.name: 03040107002.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Đạo has a food stall selling vegetable. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetable and resell.

Đạo is 61 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 03040107002.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Đạo joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Đạo has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Đạo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Đạo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Đạo hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable to resell so her family will be successful

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nancy has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales and general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs and to be able to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Adrian Orlando

texts.es: Orlando nacio  y crecio en el campo, Orlando esta en los 23 años de edad, Orlando vive con sus padres, una hermana y 2 sobrinos. Orlando comenta que recide muy alejado de la ciudad y por este motivo apenas pudo terminar la primaria. Orlando en la actualidad asiste a un curso para obtener la licencia de conducir auto y comenta que asi tiene la esperanza de poder trabajar de chofer, Orlando se dedica a la criaza de ganado y al jornal  de trabajao de agricultura. Orlando solicita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros ya que es asi como obtiene sus ingresos mediante la comercializacion de estos animales. Orlando tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y terminar de pagar del curso que esta asistiendo. Orlando comenta que le gustaria salir a vivir a la ciudad ya que en el campo no existen muchas oportunidades de mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Orlando was born and grew up in the country. He is 23 and lives with his parents, sister and 2 nephews. He says that he lives quite a distance from the city, which meant that he only just finished his primary education. He is currently learning to drive and says that he hopes to be able to work as a driver. he works as a livestock breeder and also works as a farm labourer on a daily basis. Orlando is seeking the loan to buy calves as it is by selling on these animals that he earns a living. His ambition is to improve his business by boosting his income and paying off his driving course. Orlando says that he would like to go and live in the city as there are not many opportunities to improve his quality of life in the country.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Willan Rolando

texts.es: Rolando es un señor casado, esta en sus 44 años de edad, Rolando tiene una hija de 20 años y un hijo de 23 años de edad, Rolando se dedica  a la agricultura de productos que se dan en las tierras donde el recide, a la crianza de animales menores y al cuidade de ganado, Rolando vive con esposa , sus 2 hijos y 2 nietos, Rolando solicita el dinero el credito para comprar pollos ya que comenta que si es un buen negocio. Rolando comenta que donde el vive tiene un problema ya que existe escaces del agua, Rolando tiene la aspiracion de mejorar su negocio y por medio de este mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijo y sus nietos.
texts.en: Rolando, 44, is married and has two children: a daughter, 20, and a son, 23.  He has a farming business, raising farm animals and growing crops common to this region.  He lives with his wife, children and 2 grandchildren.  He tells us that his poultry business is profitable and he is applying for a loan that he will use to stock the business with more chickens.  He says that the biggest problem he faces is the relative lack of water here.  Rolando wants to improve his business because it is his means of providing his children and grandchildren with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his poultry business.

loans.name: Enareta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Enareta works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Enareta is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea food to sell for her fish vending business.

Enareta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés en un pequeño productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 4.2 hectáreas de las cuales 2.1 son de café. En los últimos años ha logrado cosechar un promedio de 120 quintales de café pergamino. 

Su visión es duplicar el área de café en su finca, la cual cuenta con las condiciones necesarias para la producción de este rubro. Para ello se ha propuesto una plan de inversión gradual que le permita ir incrementando los rendimientos productivos y estableciendo nuevas áreas de café.

Para este año, Andrés está solicitando un financiamiento para el recepo de 0.78 hectarea de café, lo cual incrementaría su producción en un plazo de 4 años, en más de 20%. Con la implementación de un manejo semi-tecnificado de sus plantaciones y la garantía de los precios mínimos de su café que está certificado por Comercio Justo, considera que podría ir mejorando la productividad de su finca y las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is a small coffee producer from Northern Nicaragua. He owns a 4.2-hectare [450,000 square feet] property; half of it consists of coffee plantations. For the last few years, he has produced on average 120 quintals [12,000 lb.] of dry parchment coffee.

His goal is to double the size of his plantations, since the land he owns is good for growing coffee. For this, he plans to invest gradually in order to increase the yield and plant new areas with coffee.

This year Andrés is requesting a loan to replant 0.78 hectares [84,000 square feet] with coffee, which would increase his production more than 20% in the next four years. He believes that the semi-technification of his plantations and the minimum price guaranteed by the Fair Trade certificate will help him to improve the productivity of his land and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to renew part of his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en: Mrs. Dolgor, 61 years old, lives with her youngest son in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. She and her youngest son have been running a grocery store since 2014. She has four other children and all of them live on their own. The house she lives in has deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to renovate her house. She will hire employees and buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass. The renovation will make her house more comfortable and a warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutant is released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn Đông Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. She is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thúy is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Thôn Đông Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thúy has been involved in this business for 7 years.  The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell which will enable her family to prosper and have good health

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is a farmer from Tambulig. She has four children and her husband is her strong support of her farming activities. On her 13th loan cycle, she seeks a loan to pay for labor in plowing, leveling, cleaning of dikes, and to buy sacks of fertilizer. Leonida hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for labor in plowing, leveling, cleaning of dikes, and to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonara

texts.en:
Leonara is 63 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonara is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonara has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs, so as to save money to expand the business

loans.name: Erene

texts.en:
Erene is 57 years old and is married.  She has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Erene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erene requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea food to sell.

Erene has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Erene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea food to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 32 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.   Elvira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elvira has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elenita is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elenita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Elenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa es una señora que vive de su trabajo diario que es el jornal de actividades  de agricultura y la crianaza de animales menores. Rosa tiene 3 hijas que ya son casadas y viven aparte. Rosa vive con su esposo que es jornalero y con una sobrina que esta estudiando. Rosa solicita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos ya que comenta que con este negocio es como obtien sus ingresos y asi es como caco adelante a sus hijos, lo que Rosa espera es comprar mas chanchos seguir con esta actividad y asi lograr obtener ingresos  para la vejez suya y de su esposo. Rosa espera poder sacar adelante a su sobrina.
texts.en: Rosa depends on her business raising and selling farm animals.  She has 3 grown children, all of whom now live away.  She and her husband, a day laborer, live with their niece who is in school.  Rosa is applying for a loan that she will use to buy pigs for her animal sales business.  She says that the business was her means of supporting her children and helping them get ahead.  She wants to expand the business now and ensure that she and her husband have enough to live on as they get older.  She also hopes to help her niece get ahead.

loans.use: to stock her animal sales business.

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
Ernalyn is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school. Ernalyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Ernalyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn has big plans for her family. She tills her farm land in Tambulig that earns a quarterly income sufficient to provide for her family. She has been doing farming for nine years and she hopes to acquire another piece of farm land in the future. To realize her dreams, she takes care her farm and seeks a loan to pay for labor in mounting and sowing seed beds and transplant fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for labor in mounting and sowing seed beds and transplant fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tire replacement and maintenance for her jeepney.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Hải Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed fish to resell. Thúy is 22 years old and she is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn Hải Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Thúy has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase processed fish to resell, to prosper and have a happy and healthy family

loans.name: Nhóm 03,minh Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Nga is 49 years old and is married.  She has two children. Nga is the group leader of the Nhóm 03,Minh Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad is 68 years old, widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Solidad has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Solidad requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Solidad has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Solidad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell so as to expand her business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicidad is 54 years old and has six children who are in school.

Felicidad has a vegetable business in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Felicidad has been in this business for five years. In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 49 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.  Florencia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Florencia has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Joecelle

texts.en:
Joecelle is married and works hard to support her family. Joecelle has a selling soft-drinks business in the Philippines.

Joecelle requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more cases of soft-drinks to sell.

Joecelle has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Joecelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft-drinks to sell

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marcia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marcia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Marcia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old, married and has one child.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a widow woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 51 years old and both of her children are in school.

Imelda has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to resell.

Imelda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 39 years old and married.  She has four children who are in school.  Maricar works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Maricar has been in this business for 11 years.  She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda, is 27 and single.  He operates an electronics retail shop alongside earning a monthly salary from a commercial bank. He started his business in 2013 to widen his incomes and plans on starting up a wholesale shop as he plans to get married. 

The major challenge he faces is competition which affects his returns. He wants a loan to buy electronics and phones for selling.

loans.use: to buy electronics and phones for selling.

loans.name: Hugo Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo es un joven trabajador, hace un año atrás termino la secundaria y en la actualidad asiste a un curso para obtener la licencia para conducir auto ya que mas adelante espera poder trabajar de chofer. Marcelo vive con sus padres que no tiene la facilidades economicas. Marcelo comenta que sus padres no tienen los recursos economicos como para pagar estudios superiores ni suyos ni de sus hermanos. Marcelo juntamente con sus padres se dedican al jornal y a la crianza de animales, Marcelo solicita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos. Marcelo espera mejorar su negocio, comprar mas chanchos para que sus ingresos aumenten y de ahí tener para pagar del curso al que esta asistiendo  y para quedar bien en sus pagos del credito.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a hard-working young man. He finished high school a year ago and now attends a course to become licensed to drive a car. Later, he hopes to work as a driver.

Marcelo lives with his parents who do not have much money. Marcelo says his parents do not have the economic resources to pay for higher education for him or his siblings. He and his parents work as day laborers and also in animal husbandry.

Marcelo asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs. He hopes to improve his business, and to buy more pigs and by this to increase his income. Then he can pay for the course he is currently attending, and then he will be able to repay his credit.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mergin

texts.en:
Mergin works hard to support her family. Mergin is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Mergin has been in this business for nine years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is a 53-year-old businesswoman from Tambulig. She has a piece of riceland that primarily supports her family. She balances her time between managing her agri business and being a wife and mother. 

Engracia is thankful that she signed up her membership with the Cooperative and has them as her financing partner. She has applied for another loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals. 

In the future, she wants to expand her business by purchasing more riceland in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Merla has a buy-and-sell personal products business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of personal care products to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of personal care products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 53-year-old married woman with nine children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margarita has a auto repair shop business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts and maintain equipment for her business.

Margarita has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and maintain equipment for her auto repair business.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Irenia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Irenia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a range of products for her retail business.

loans.name: Flor Angela

texts.es: Ubicada en el municipio de Soledad se encuentra la tienda de víveres y abarrotes de Flor Ángela, esta carismática mujer desde niña trabajó en tiendas y graneros de propiedad de su familia, de quienes heredó la vocación en este oficio.  Con unos ahorros aperturó su propio negocio, en el barrio Nueva Esperanza al observar que en el sector no existían tiendas, oportunidad  que aprovecho para retomar nuevamente esta actividad.  Diariamente en el horario de 6 a.m. a 8 p.m., los vecinos pueden realizar sus compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, huevos, leche en polvo, harina, pastas, galletas, enlatados, refrescos, detergentes, jabones, desodorantes, toallas higiénicas y demás productos de la canasta familiar, y les ofrece comodidad de pago.  Sus compras las realiza a graneros y depósitos mayoristas, quienes le han ofrecido confianza y sus pagos los puede realizar de contado o a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir el negocio con víveres como  arroz, aceite, huevos, leche en polvo, harina, pastas, galletas, enlatados y refrescos, e invertir en un enfriador.  Esta inversión mejorará la conservación de alimentos que necesitan estar refrigerados y sus clientes encontrarán todo lo que necesitan en un solo lugar.  Flor es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad a quienes desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Located in the municipality of Soledad, you can find Flor Angela's grocery and food store. This charismatic woman has worked in stores and warehouses belonging to her family since she was a child. She has inherited the tradition of this work from them.

With some savings she opened her own business in the Nuevo Esperanza seeing that the area had no stores, an opportunity she took advantage of in order to return to this business. Her timetable is from 6 am until 8 pm daily. Her neighbors can buy their food such as rice, oil, eggs, milk powder, flour, pasta, biscuits, canned products, soft drinks, detergent, soap, deodorant, sanitary napkins and other basic household items and she offers them easy payments. She makes her purchases at wholesale warehouses and depots who have confidence in her and she can pay in cash or on credit.

At this time she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to stock her business with food like rice, sugar, eggs, milk powder, flour, pasta, biscuits and soft drinks and invest in a cooler. This investment will help her keep the foods that need to be refrigerated and her clients will be able to find everything they need in one place. Flor is the mother of 3 children who she wants to provide a better quality of living.

loans.use: to stock her business with food like rice, sugar, eggs, milk powder, flour, pasta, biscuits and soft drinks and invest in a cooler.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Hòa Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed fish to resell.

Thủy is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Hòa Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thủy has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase processed fish to resell so that the business does well and her children will prosper

loans.name: Madres Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Madre solidaria está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, Solicitan por octavo ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, el grupo es coordinado por la señora Deyanira de 41 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 8 años, con el crédito anterior logro comprar un frízer y una vitrina, una de sus metas es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea, donde pueda ofrecerle a sus clientes todo tipo de productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y gaseosa, la segunda socia es la joven Eimee de 33 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes AVON y la tercer socia es doña Ana de 37 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de Fritanga desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Madre Solidaria is made up of three hardworking women. They are requesting their eighth cycle of financing from ADIM. 

The group is coordinated by Deyanira, 41 years old, partnered and mother of two children. She has been the owner of a small grocery store in her home for the past 8 years. With the previous loan, she was able to purchase a freezer and a display case. One of her goals is to convert her small grocery store into a general store where she can offer her customers all kinds of products. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, and soda pop. 

The second member is Eimee, 33 years old, who works selling AVON perfumes, and the third member is Ana, 37 years old, who has been selling home-style Nicaraguan food for the last 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, and soda pop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie has more than a decade of running her business. She finds pleasure in doing farming activities. At the age of 38 with 4 children to feed, she doubles her effort to take care her farming activities. She owes to Paglaum all her capital needs. 

Recently, she availed another loan to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers. In the future, Elsie hopes to open a display outlet for their produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For 13 years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. Amelita requested a 26,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent, shampoo, candies, cereals, coffee, snack foods, etc. to sell. Amelita has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. Amelita aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 30 years old and all of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ramilita

texts.en:
Ramilita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell. Ramilita has been in this business for 15 years. Ramilita earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ramilita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and has two children. Rebecca is married and one child is still in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rebecca has been in this business for 5 years and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta works hard to support her family. Restituta is married and has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

Restituta requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products such as body lotion, soap, perfume and other personal items to sell.

Restituta has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as body lotion, soap, perfume and other personal items to sell

loans.name: Marefe

texts.en:
Marefe is 49 years old, married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Marefe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marefe has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Marefe aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell and to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Nam Ngạn 3, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Anh, 41, is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa City in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Nam Ngạn 3, Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. Anh has operated a food stall and restaurant selling fruit for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits to resell. In 2011, Anh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Anh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa.

With her business profit, Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Nam Ngạn 3,nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngân has a retail business selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to resell.

Ngân is 59 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Ngân is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Nam Ngạn 3,Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Ngân has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Ngân has been involved in this business for 3 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell for her family to be happy and healthy

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is Microfinance Member of Paglaum. She has 5 children and manages a riceland in Tambulig. She cultivates the piece of land to support her family. 

She has accessed her 2nd loan in the Cooperative to pay for land preparation and buy sacks of fertilizers. In the future, Sherlita hopes to own a mechanized tractor to easily till her riceland.

loans.use: To pay for labor in land preparation and to buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals and save for a mechanized tiller

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from running a general store. Merlina is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business. Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.
She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rizalinda

texts.en:
Rizalinda is 65 years old and married with five children. Rizalinda works very hard to provide for family.

Rizalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil and other personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rizalinda has been in this business for 9 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Luchadores Group

texts.es:
DIGNA tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos.  Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo(ropa, zapatos, perfumes). esta actividad ha sido muy importante para ella y sus hijos, vive en la casa de su mamà en Esmeraldas.
es la primera vez que gestiona un credito. y se siente muy bien de hacerlo en Vision Fund.
para realizar su trabajo, ella sale a recorrer varios barrios de la ciudad, promocionando sus productos.
las ganancias obtenidas, las ha invertido en la educacion de sus hijos, alimentacion, salud y en sus propios estudios de preparacion para maestra.
se entero de Visionfund por su mamà que es clienta tambien de esta institucion financiera.
con los ahorros que genere, desea poder empezar a construir su propia casa, abastecerse de productos, alquilar un local para poder trabajar mejor.
texts.en:
DIGNA, 35, is a single mother with 3 children.  She has operated a retail business for 5 years, selling merchandise (clothing, shoes, perfumes) that she orders from catalogs and resells to her customers.  The business has been her means of supporting herself and her children.  
Digna lives with her mother in Esmeraldas.  This is her first loan and she is grateful, she says, to Vision Fund for supporting her business.  Her customers live in all parts of the city and her earnings from the business cover her main expenses: food, healthcare, schooling for her children, and expenses related to her own studies to be a teacher.  
Digna's mother, a member of Vision Fund before, brought her to the group.  Digna hopes to save enough from her business to build a house of her own and rent a shop where she can better operate her business.

loans.use: to buy catalog merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés es un pequeño productor en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, dedicado a la caficultura desde hace más de 7 años. Su finca es de 9.8 hectáreas, de las cuales 2.1 son de café. Su producción anual promedio en los últimos tres años ha sido de 80 quintales de café pergamino, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

Para garantizar una buena cosecha este ciclo, Andrés requiere darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones, por lo que está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que garanticen la nutrición adecuada de su cafetal.

Esta pequeña inversión ayudará a que él obtenga mejores rendimientos productivos y con ello mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is a small farmer in a rural community in Jinotega who has made his living growing coffee for more than 7 years. His farm is 9.8 hectares, 2.1 of which are coffee. His average annual production for the last three years has been 80 quintales (8,000 lbs) of parchment coffee which he manages under the criteria for free trade certification. 

In order to ensure a good harvest this season Andres needs to properly maintain his fields and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to ensure adequate nourishment for his coffee plants. This small investment will help him to get better yields, and with them,  higher income to improve his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers that he will apply to his coffee trees to ensure a good harvest this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Don De Dios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Don de Dios esta conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por la señora Adela, casada y madre de siete hijos mayores de edad e independientes, se dedica a la venta de ropa y nacatamales, desde hace dos años el crédito lo solicita para la compra de hojas de chagüite, maíz, cebolla, tomate, cerdo, arroz y papa. La segunda socia es Cinthya de 23 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas de acero hace cuatro años y la tercer socia es doña Rita de 61 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 30 años.
texts.en: The Don de Dios community bank has three hard-working members, all women.  The group's coordinator, Adela, is married and the mother of seven grown children.  Adela used a previous loan, two years ago, to start a retail food sales business: she bought chaguite, maize, onions, tomatoes, pork and other ingredients for making nacatamales.  (She also buys and sells clothing.)  The other members of the group are Cinthya, 23, who has operated a retail sales business for four years and Rita, 61, who has operated a corner grocery for 30 years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Kadan Group

texts.en:
Khammerd understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Khammerd knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khammerd purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  

The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Khammerd is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a Microfinance member of Pagluam Multi Purpose Cooperative. He has a piece of agricultural land in Tambulig. As a hardworking father of 3 he labors a lot to sufficiently provide the needs of his children. For this cropping season, he availed a loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his farming activities. Ricardo wants to see all his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his farming activities, so that his children finish their studies

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, muy respetada en su comunidad, dado porque siempre anda ayudando a otros en lo que se pueda, ella con el apoyo de su hija mayor inicio un negocio de venta de comida, su esposo el cual es mecánico automotriz, es el primero es afirmar que como cocina Miriam, no cocina nadie. 
Esta responsable mujer, goza con una gran clientela, es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva junto MiCrédito para que se le beneficie con un préstamo que le permita comprar más ingredientes, vegetales, carnes, entre otros, para aumentar su producción de platos de comida. En un futuro a corto plazo ella pretende vender su comida a los trabajadores del mercado más cercano. Su sueño más grande es hacer de su negocio un restaurante.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 48-year-old woman.  She is very respected in her community, given that she is always going around helping others however she can.  With the support of her oldest daughter, she started her own business selling meals.  Her husband is an auto mechanic; he is the first one to speak out in favor of Miriam’s cooking—no one cooks like she does.

This responsable woman enjoys a large customer base.  This is why she is turning to Kiva, together with MiCrédito, so that she can benefit from a loan that will allow her to buy more ingredients such as vegetables and meats, among others, to increase her meal production.  In the short-term, she plans on selling her food to the workers in the closest market.  Her biggest dream is to turn her business into a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients: vegetables and meats, among other items.

loans.name: Lualdi

texts.en:
Lualdi is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lualdi is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lualdi has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Kadje's Group

texts.fr: Kadje qui se trouve sur la photo assit devant tout le monde, elle porte foulard orange et tiens la pochette de MyAgro est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de M'Piebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Kadje, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 17 à 35 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille a incité Kadje à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Kadje cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Kadje entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro.
