Cette année Kadje effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Kadje cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Kadje planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage des moutons et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme la daba . Enfin Kadje espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kadje, sitting in front of everyone in the photo, is wearing an orange scarf and holding a myAgro pouch. She is a member of a group of ten farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of M'Piebougou, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. Kadje, aged 56, is the mother of six children, from 17 to 35 years old, of whom one is currently in school.

Farming enables Kadje to ensure her family’s self-sufficiency and thus has been encouraged to do this work for 30 years now. She grows peanuts, corn, and millet on her parcel of land. But as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as a lack of rain, farm equipment, and herbicides. 

Kadje is starting her second year with myAgro and signed up because of her aim aim of increasing crop yields through the services offered by myAgro and because of the conviction of myAgro representatives on the benefits of myAgro methods. This year, Kadje is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase yields on her 0.125 hectare parcel of land. 

For thirty years, Kadje has been growing peanuts for its value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have a commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market. 

With greater yields and higher income, Kadje is planning on raising sheep and buying farm equipment, such as a daba [a kind of hoe]. Ultimately, she also hopes to cover the children’s schooling costs, as well as to finance her children’s marriages.

loans.use: to get a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts and to benefit from training and myAgro farming techniques

loans.name: Sergio Rolando

texts.es: Sergio, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene una hija, y reside en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Hace 14 años que Sergio se dedica a la elaboración de muebles, sillas, reparaciones de muebles, y tapizados. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y es su única fuente de ingresos. Ha solicitado 20,000 Lempiras para comprar materiales como ser esponjas, telas, pegamento, madera, pinturas, lijas etc. con el fin de sacar los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes. El tiene planes de utilizar las ganancias para mejorar el local del negocio y también darle buena educación a su hija.
texts.en: Sergio is 43 years old, he lives with his common-law wife with whom he has a daughter. He lives in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes. For fourteen years Sergio has been making furniture, chairs, repairing furniture, and doing upholstery. He does this work in his home, and it is his sole source of income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to purchase materials such as sponges, fabric, glue, wood, paint, sandpaper etc. in order to complete his customers' pending jobs. He plans to use his earnings to improve his work space, and to give his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sponges, fabrics, glue, wood, paint, sandpaper etc. to make, repair and upholster furniture.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 41 years old and has three children still in school.

Violeta has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her stall.

Violeta has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her stall so that she may send her children to college

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don Jose de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para  tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Jose is sixty-two years old, he lives in his own home with his family. He grows rice and beans, he has been doing this for fifteen years. He sells his produce in surrounding villages, and with his earnings he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers etc. so he can keep on working and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to investin new drinking water pipes because the current ones are in bad condition and have many leaks.

loans.name: Las 3 B Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario las 3 B está conformado por tres microempresarias exitosas, quienes solicitan por cuarto ciclo el financiamiento de ADIM, el grupo es coordinado por la señora Felipa de 60 años de edad, viuda y madre de tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y perfumes desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de abanicos, televisores, planchas y arroceras, con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su estilo de vida, la segunda socia es Ángela de 29 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y la tercer socia es Anielka de 25 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Las 3 B" is composed of three successful micro-entrepreneurs who are requesting their fourth cycle of financing through ADIM. The group's coordinator is Mrs. Felipa who is 60 years old, a widow and the mother of 3 older independent children.

Felipa has been selling domestic electrical appliances and perfumes for the last three years. She is soliciting the loan to purchase fans, televisions, irons and rice cookers to sell. With her previous loan Felipa managed to improve her style of life.

The second member is Angela who is 29 years old. She sells used clothing. And the third member is Anieka who is 25 years old and dedicated to selling new and used clothing.

loans.use: buy fans, televisions, irons and rice cookers to sell.

loans.name: Tenin's Group

texts.fr: Tenin qui se trouve debout, au centre du deuxième rang sur la photo, elle porte un T-shirt blanc et tiens le drapeau de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 13 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Dianikoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Tenin, âgée de 37 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 18 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Tenin à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 14 ans. Tenin cultive l'arachide, le fonio sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de terres cultivables. Tenin entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Tenin effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 12 ans que Tenin cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Tenin planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce et de l'elevage.
texts.en:
Tenin, standing in the middle of the second row in the photo, wearing a white T-shirt, and holding the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of thirteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Dianikoro, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 37 years old and the mother of seven children, aged 1 to 18, of whom three are currently in school. 

Tenin is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. And she married a farmer, she was thus encouraged to do this work for 14 years now. She grows peanuts and fonio [a type of millet] on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of farm equipment, quality fertilizers, and arable land. 

Tenin is starting her second year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality fertilizer, as well as the possibility of increasing her harvest through the services offered by myAgro. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase yields on her 0.125 hectare parcel of land. 

For twelve years, Tenin has been farming peanuts for their productive and market advantages. With greater yields and higher income, she is planning on working in commerce and raising livestock.

loans.use: to get a packet of fertilizer for growing peanuts and to benefit from training and myAgro farming technique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of beer in order to meet market demands.

loans.name: Quintino

texts.en:
Quintino has signed up his membership in 2014. He has accessed a loan for his farming activities. 

For this cropping season, he applied another loan to pay for leveling and cleaning of dikes. He wants to make sure that everything is ready for his farming activities. Quintino hopes to have a good harvest so that he can purchase another piece of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to pay for leveling and cleaning of dikes prior to planting for the new season

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 43 años, está casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el segundo  préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, married and lives with his wife.   The loan is to buy fertilizer and seeding materials for his coffee plantation that he wants to start.  He wishes to take good care to his field so that he can have a larger production and better income.  He hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future.  He also wants to keep growing as a person and as a coffee producer.  
This is José Antonio's second loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make improvements to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nasan Group

texts.en:
Veota is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Veota and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Veota and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Veota and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Veota and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Maya lives with her husband and two daughters in Dakshin Parengerpar village at Falakata. She is illiterate and can sign her name only. Her daughters are studying in a local village school. Maya wants to see her daughters in a respectable position with a good education; thus she always provide every support to them.

Maya, jointly with her husband, runs a grocery store. She sells general grocery items such as salt, sugar, oil, spices, biscuits, eggs, flour, etc. and also some daily essential commodities. There are many other grocery stores nearby, so Maya wants to expand her business and buy more stock of grocery items for her store so that she can attract more customers and generate more income for her family. But Maya does not have sufficient capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to enlarge her business. She will use the loan amount to buy more stock of grocery items for her grocery shop. She hopes this will give a boost to her business as well as her income. Maya is dedicated to make her business successful and provide financial sustenance to her family.

She thanks her lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bouroulae's Group

texts.fr: Bouroulaye qui se trouve sur la photo portant un kepi dans le dernier rang, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Gueleba au sud de Bamako au Mali. Bouroulaye, âgé de 53 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 16 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Bouroulaye à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Bouroulaye cultive le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles  . Bouroulaye entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de l’image et le bon fonctionnement de myAgro. Cette année Bouroulaye effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 6 ans que Bouroulaye cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Bouroulaye planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’acheter des matériels agricoles.
texts.en:
Bouroulaye, appearing in the last row in the photo and wearing a kepi, is a member of a group of eleven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Gueleba, south of Bamako, in Mali. He is 53 years old and the father of seven children, aged 1 to 16, of whom three are currently in school. 

Farming enables Bouroulaye to ensure his family’s self-sufficiency. And he loves farming, thus he has been encouraged to do this work for 20 years now. He grows corn and rice on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of farm equipment. 

Bouroulaye is starting his first year with myAgro and signed up because of myAgro’s image and proper operations. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his 0.25-hectare parcel of land. He has been growing corn for 6 years for its productive and market advantages. 

With greater yields and higher income, Bouroulaye is planning on buying farm equipment.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Nam Ngạn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết operates a soft drink store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drink to resell.

Tuyết is 42 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Tuyết is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Nam Ngạn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 8 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  Tuyết has been involved in this business for 5 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drink to resell, for the benefit of her family
